items.title: India’s problem isn’t restrictive labour laws but a failure to innovate—Making workers work harder won’t help
items.summary: Indian industrialists often point to restrictive labour laws as holding development back. But India’s low R&amp;D spend is the real problem. Greater leeway on labour deployment can’t be expected to make much of a difference.

items.title: How the IndiGo crisis unfolded: A timeline of cancelled flights, DGCA probe and thousands of stranded passengers
items.summary: We take a look at the timeline of events during aviation major IndiGo's crisis. The domestic carrier has said that it expects services to normalise by February 2026, amid probe from the DGCA and concerns raised in the Indian Parliament. Here's a look…

items.title: IndiGo Flight Cancelled: How to claim refund or rebook your ticket—Full process explained
items.summary: IndiGo Cancelled Flight Refund Rules: Under DGCA rules, even passengers holding non-refundable or promotional tickets must get back all taxes and statutory airport charges if they do not travel. Refunds must be processed to the original mode of payment. For tickets booked through travel agents or other portals, the refund will be issued through the same channel.

items.title: RBI Cuts Repo Rate to 5.25%: Here's how you can save Rs 45,000/year on a Rs 50 lakh loan
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday reduced the key benchmark repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25 per cent, the first rate cut in six months. The central bank also retained a neutral stance, leaving room for potential further cuts.

items.title: IndiGo Flight Chaos Deepens: 1,000+ flights cancelled in 36 hours, sparking political and safety concerns
items.summary: IndiGo Flight Chaos: IndiGo’s growing dominance in the skies is raising questions about a potential monopoly in India’s aviation sector.

items.title: RBI rate cut to lower home loan rates, stimulate housing demand: Industry bodies
items.summary: Real estate industry bodies CREDAI and NAREDCO on Friday said RBI's move to cut repo rate by 25 basis points would lead to reduction in interest rates on home loans and boost housing demand.

items.title: DGCA eases FDTL rules amid IndiGo flight disruptions; appeals for pilot cooperation
items.summary: Under the new instruction, a pilot’s leave will now be counted as rest, overturning the previous clause that stated “no leave shall be substituted for weekly rest”.

items.title: Frontline banks remain best bet in financials:  Manishi Raychaudhuri
items.summary: India's economy shows strong macro stability with controlled inflation and deficits, but micro-level concerns persist, particularly in corporate earnings. Market veteran Manishi Raychaudhuri highlights low inflation and high real rates offering monetary policy room. While festive demand boosted sentiment, sustained earnings upgrades are awaited for broader market optimism, especially in consumer discretionary and select financials.

items.title: RBI rate cut, FX swap knock forwards lower; weak rupee outlook caps fall
items.summary: The Indian rupee forward premiums dropped on Friday following the central bank's rate cut and forex swap, though currency traders say a softer spot trajectory should cap the downside.

items.title: IndiGo chaos brings travel to its knees; metro city passengers now need to shell out up to ₹35,000 to fly or try another day
items.summary: Mass cancellations by IndiGo have turned air travel into a scramble, with packed airports and soaring airfares. Passengers face overnight surges in last-minute and weekend ticket prices, with busy metro routes seeing fares jump two to five times their usual levels. This disruption has transformed basic travel into an expensive crisis for many.

items.title: Aequs IPO: Final day to bid! Check latest subscription status here
items.summary: The basis of allotment of the IPO shares is expected to be finalised tentatively on December 8, 2025, and the stock is expected to list on both the stock exchanges (BSE and NSE) on December 10, 2025, tentatively.

items.title: SBI Card to DLF - Prashanth Tapse of Mehta Equities suggests stocks to buy in the short term
items.summary: Stock market indices Sensex and Nifty 50 rose significantly after the RBI cut interest rates by 25 bps to 5.25%. Despite volatility, Sensex gained 425.57 points, while Nifty 50 increased by 136.65 points. Experts expect the rate cut to enhance loan affordability and stimulate economic growth.

items.title: Benchmark JGB yields hit 18-year high as BOJ rate-hike bets gather steam
items.summary: Benchmark Japanese government bonds (JGBs) slid further on Friday, pushing yields to an 18-year high, as expectations firmed for rate hikes by the Bank of Japan.

items.title: Vedanta moves Delhi high court against taxman’s  ₹1,308-cr avoidance allegation under India–Mauritius treaty
items.summary: The tax dept's general anti-avoidance rules approving panel claimed Vedanta secured treaty benefits by routing promoter shareholding through Mauritius to access the 5% dividend withholding tax rate instead of the applicable 10–15%

items.title: RBI rate cut, FX swap knock forwards lower; weak rupee outlook caps fall
items.summary: The Indian rupee forward premiums dropped on Friday following the central bank's rate cut and forex swap, though currency traders say a softer spot trajectory should cap the downside.

items.title: Euro zone 30-year yields head for biggest weekly rise since August
items.summary: Global bond markets are experiencing a significant sell-off, particularly in ultra-long debt, driven by persistent worries about government finances. Japanese government bonds are leading this trend, with yields on 30-year JGBs reaching record highs. This surge is also impacting Euro zone yields, with German long-dated bonds seeing their largest increase in three months.

items.title: European shares steady after three-day rally; focus on US inflation
items.summary: European stock markets showed stability on Friday, aiming for a weekly gain. Investors are keenly watching crucial US inflation figures. This data could shape the Federal Reserve's decisions on interest rates. Basic resources and industrial stocks saw significant increases. Swiss Re shares dropped after its 2026 targets fell short. Ocado's stock surged on a payment from Kroger.

items.title: Ola Electric stock tanks to record low, 6-day rout causes 51% drop from September peak
items.summary: The decline in OLA Electric shares continues, hitting a record low of  ₹34.81, a 15% drop over six sessions. Despite narrowing losses, the company cut sales forecasts significantly and is now focusing on its Battery Energy Storage System amid tough market conditions.

items.title: IndiGo Flight Cancellations: DGCA asks its inspectors to operate for IndiGo, waives off new pilot rest rules
items.summary: IndiGo Flight Cancellations: IndiGo faces widespread flight cancellations due to pilot shortages. The DGCA is deploying its inspectors to operate flights for the airline. New pilot rest rules have seen relaxations, including caps on night landings. IndiGo is reducing its flight schedule significantly as it works to stabilize operations. The airline seeks time until February 10 to fully recover.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei loses ground as investor focus shifts to BOJ, Fed meetings
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei share average lost ground on Friday, pausing after a recent rally, as expectations of rising domestic interest rates weighed on sentiment.

items.title: India weighs greater phone-location surveillance; Apple, Google and Samsung protest
items.summary: The Indian government is reviewing a telecom industry proposal to force smartphone makers to keep satellite-based location tracking (A-GPS) always active for law enforcement purposes. The move, aimed at providing authorities with precise user locations, has raised strong privacy concerns from Apple, Google, and Samsung, who argue it would turn phones into “dedicated surveillance devices” and pose legal, security, and privacy risks.

items.title: 5 deeper stress signals for Nifty investors even as RBI cuts rates on 'Goldilocks' phase
items.summary: The RBI’s 25 bps rate cut and aggressive liquidity infusion signal rising stress beneath India’s “Goldilocks” growth narrative. Despite record-high GDP prints, weak nominal growth, a sliding rupee, persistent FII outflows and narrow market breadth reveal deeper cracks that Nifty investors must track even as policy support strengthens.

items.title: Pilots Association writes to DGCA, flags safety concerns over FDTL phase II implementation granted to IndiGo
items.summary: The Airline Pilots' Association of India (ALPA India) has strongly objected to selective dispensations granted to IndiGo under the revised Flight Duty Time Limit (FDTL) CAR Phase II, calling them unsafe and commercially motivated. ALPA said these exemptions undermine pilot safety, dilute FDTL regulations, and contradict prior agreements with the DGCA, which were meant to safeguard passengers and crew.

items.title: Godrej Consumer needs to check many boxes for earnings revival
items.summary: A meaningful lift in consolidated performance hinges on stronger volume growth outside soaps, reduced pricing pressure in soaps, and improved international operations, particularly in Indonesia.

items.title: Encompass Design India IPO Day 1: Here's GMP, subscription status, and other details
items.summary: The shares of Encompass Design India IPO is currently not trading in the grey market. This means that the GMP of Encompass Design India IPO is +0, as per investorgain.

items.title: Kaynes Technology share drops over 8% as brokerages Kotak, JP Morgan raise red flags
items.summary: Kaynes Technology shares dropped over 8% amid accounting concerns raised by brokerages. Kotak highlighted inconsistencies in financial disclosures, while JPMorgan advised caution due to weak cash flows and balance sheet pressures.&nbsp;

items.title: Ola Electric to hire 1,000 senior service technicians as hyperservice enters next phase
items.summary: Ola Electric is set to recruit 1,000 senior service technicians and specialists. This move strengthens its after-sales network. The company aims to enhance repair accuracy and customer experience. This expansion is part of the Hyperservice program. It focuses on improving service consistency across India.

items.title: RBI monetary policy: How a 125 bps repo rate cut in 2025 would impact your monthly home loan EMI?
items.summary: RBI monetary policy: As RBI has reduced repo rate by 125 bps in 2025, the monthly home loan EMI of a  ₹50 lakh loan taken at 9% per annum for 15 years at the beginning of 2025 would now come down from  ₹54,713 to  ₹47,064

items.title: RBI Monetary Policy: Full text of RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra's speech
items.summary: Since the October policy, the Indian economy has witnessed rapid disinflation, with inflation coming down to an unprecedentedly low level. For the first time since the adoption of flexible inflation targeting (FIT), average headline inflation for a quarter at 1.7 per cent in Q2:2025-26, breached the lower tolerance threshold (2 per cent) of the inflation target (4 per cent).

items.title: IndiGo’s punctuality hits record low, collapses to 8.5%, as operational disruptions mount
items.summary: IndiGo's on-time performance drastically dropped to 8.5% on Thursday, significantly impacting flight schedules due to ongoing operational disruptions, primarily crew-related issues. This marks a sharp decline from previous days, with the airline now cancelling flights to manage the situation. Other major airlines maintained considerably higher punctuality rates.

items.title: Air India, Maldivian sign interline pact to make your next holiday to Maldives easier
items.summary: Air India and Maldivian have partnered to boost travel between India and the Maldives. Passengers can now book single tickets for seamless journeys. Air India flights will connect to 16 Maldivian destinations via Malé. Maldivian passengers gain access to Air India's network from Delhi and Mumbai. This collaboration aims to improve accessibility and strengthen tourism ties between the two nations.

items.title: Liquidity won’t be a constraint: Dinesh Kumar Khara  on RBI policy, growth outlook & rupee strategy
items.summary: Former SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara says RBI’s latest 25 bps rate cut will gradually transmit through the banking system, supporting economic growth. He explains why the Monetary Policy Committee kept its stance neutral, when a shift may come, how liquidity will be managed, and why bank margins are likely to stabilise despite rising credit-deposit ratios and deposit repricing pressures.

items.title: Market may deliver 12–15% returns next year, but midcap outperformance unlikely: Sandip Sabharwal
items.summary: Investor Sandip Sabharwal urges caution on stretched valuations and corporate disclosures. He sees opportunities in financials, auto stocks, and L&T for the coming year. Largecap stocks appear solid, with midcap opportunities to emerge gradually. Sabharwal anticipates market returns of 12-15% across segments. He also notes pressure on Eternal due to quick commerce losses.

items.title: From Boom to Gloom: 10 multibagger stocks of 2024 fall up to 68% in 2025
Rupee at 90: RBI Governor Malhotra says no targeted band, market will decide currency level
items.summary: Reserve Bank of India Governor Sanjay Malhotra stated the central bank does not target specific levels for the rupee, allowing market forces to dictate its value. He emphasised that the RBI intervenes only to curb extreme volatility, not to support the currency.

items.title: Gold price can touch $4,800 in 2026 —What it means for your portfolio allocation
items.summary: Gold prices are set to rise further in 2026, driven by central bank buying and inflation concerns. Ventura predicts a target of $4,600–$4,800, with strong demand from institutional investors. HDFC Securities recommends a 5–10% portfolio allocation to gold amid ongoing market volatility.

items.title: Chaos in the Skies: IndiGo flights disrupted at Jaipur airport again
items.summary: The situation was extremely stressful for travelers heading for work, emergencies, or important personal matters. This is not an isolated incident. Similar flight disruptions were reported yesterday, indicating ongoing operational problems with IndiGo flights at Jaipur.

items.title: Why RBI put more glitter on the "rare Goldilocks period"
items.summary: The RBI’s MPC cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, taking total 2025 cuts to 125 bps, amid a rare mix of record-low inflation and strong growth. Governor Sanjay Malhotra called it a “Goldilocks” moment as the RBI used its widened policy space to support demand despite global headwinds.

items.title: NIIF to consider selling stake in smart power meter firm IntelliSmart
items.summary: New Delhi-based IntelliSmart was set up as a joint venture between NIIF and Energy Efficiency Services Ltd. in 2019 to roll out a smart meter program to Indian power companies, according to an announcement at the time. The meters can be read remotely and are also used to identify network failures, as well as provide consumption data to help households reduce their energy bills.

items.title: RBI cuts rates by 25 bps, announces OMO purchases: Should you adjust your bond investment strategy now?
items.summary: The RBI's recent 25 bps rate cut and OMO purchases have significant implications for bond investments. Experts suggest locking in current yields for 12- to 18-month durations.&nbsp;

items.title: PM Modi, Putin hold talks at Hyderabad House
items.summary: Earlier in the day, the Russian President was also accorded ceremonial welcome at the forecourt of Rashtrapati Bhavan and was given a guard of honour.

items.title: IndiGo cancels flights from Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad and other airports: Check full list here
items.summary: IndiGo Flights Status: IndiGo cancelled over 500 flights nationwide on Friday, with Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru and Hyderabad severely impacted by hundreds of disruptions. This marks the fourth consecutive day of widespread cancellations, leaving thousands of passengers stranded and facing significant inconvenience across major Indian airports.

items.title: Cohesity announces $1 billion India investment to boost AI, cybersecurity capabilities
items.summary: Cohesity CEO Sanjay Poonen said the investment will focus on expanding the company’s technical teams and building advanced AI-driven capabilities that help enterprises protect and manage their data amid rising cybersecurity threats.

items.title: After Delhi and Mumbai chaos, IndiGo to cancel over 100 Bengaluru flights amid nationwide disruptions
items.summary: India's largest airline, IndiGo, has cancelled over 100 flights from Bengaluru and more nationwide due to a severe cabin crew shortage. This operational instability has led to widespread disruptions, with over 1,000 flights cancelled recently. Full normalcy is not expected until February 2026.

items.title: Helloji Holidays SME IPO allotment likely today: GMP and steps to check share allotment status online for the SME IPO
items.summary: Helloji Holidays' IPO attracted significant investor interest, with the allotment date set for December 5, 2025. The IPO was open for subscription from December 2-4. Shares will list on the BSE SME platform on December 9, with refunds for non-allottees processed on December 8.

items.title: IndiGo Goa crisis: 30 flights from Dabolim cancelled, flyer frustration peaks
items.summary: The disruptions, affecting flights to major cities including Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, Delhi, Mumbai and Ahmedabad, prompted the airport authorities to urge passengers to verify their flight status before travelling.

items.title: ₹0.05 to  ₹29.80: Multibagger penny stock turns  ₹1 lakh into  ₹5.96 crore in five years
items.summary: On Friday, the multibagger penny stock rallied as much as 5% to  ₹29.80 on BSE. The penny stock has more than quadruped its investors wealth by surging nearly 59,500% in last five years.

items.title: Dollar vs Rupee: INR falls as RBI announces rate cut by 25 bps to 5.25%
items.summary: Weakness in trade and capital flows has bogged down the rupee this year, with the drag compounded by steep U.S. trade tariffs, pushing the currency below the 90 per dollar mark.

items.title: Putin's India Visit: PM Modi, President Murmu accord full honours to Russian president at Rashtrapati Bhavan
items.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in New Delhi on Thursday evening, where Prime Minister Modi personally received him at the Palam airport.

items.title: RBI’s rate cut is a surprise, given its recent signals, but whether it’ll spur investment is the question
items.summary: RBI deemed growth in need of monetary policy support amid low inflation and made an assurance of liquidity, which usually tightens in December, though its $5 billion dollar swap is curious. Whether RBI’s rate cut will spur investment is now the question.

items.title: RBI's Big Liquidity Boost: Rs 1 lakh-crore OMO purchases, USD/INR swap—A point-by-point summary
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra has announced major liquidity measures to aid the domestic banking system, including bond purchases to the tune Rs 1 lakh crore this month. Here's a quick take.

items.title: Andhra approves Rs 4,000-crore ReNew Photovoltaics solar ingot, wafer facility
items.summary: Andhra Pradesh has approved a major solar manufacturing plant. ReNew Photovoltaics will build a Rs 4,000-crore facility in Anakapalli district. This project aims to boost India's solar capacity and reduce reliance on imported components. The plant is expected to be operational by January 2028, creating many jobs.

items.title: SpiceJet shares jump 9% as IndiGo turbulence hits sector. GMR Airports slips 2% on travel chaos
items.summary: SpiceJet rose sharply as massive IndiGo flight disruptions boosted sentiment for the stock. IndiGo’s operational troubles, driven by crew shortages and new duty-hour rules, triggered over 400 cancellations, weighing on InterGlobe Aviation shares and shifting momentum across aviation-linked stocks.

items.title: Park Medi World IPO: Price band set at  ₹154-162 per share; check key details, issue details, more
items.summary: Park Medi World has set its IPO price band at  ₹154-162, with subscription from December 10-12. It aims to raise  ₹770 crore, focusing on debt repayment and hospital development, while shares will list on BSE and NSE on December 17.

items.title: PG Electroplast: When a multibagger meets monsoon
items.summary: After a four-year surge in revenue, profit and stock price, PG Electroplast is facing slowing AC demand, weaker cash flows and reduced guidance, raising questions over valuation and promoter moves.

items.title: Nine bidders for GVK's Alaknanda hydro power plant
items.summary: Nine bidders, including Adani Power and JSW Energy, have submitted formal offers ranging from Rs 3,000 crore to Rs 4,000 crore for GVK Energy's operational 330 MW Alaknanda hydro power plant. The plant, with a PPA until 2045, has significant debt, with unsecured creditors holding the majority of claims.

items.title: IndiGo faces structural turbulence but long-term dominance intact: Sandip Sabharwal
items.summary: Market expert Sandip Sabharwal views rupee depreciation as inevitable due to trade deficits, while anticipating a US Fed rate cut. He sees easing overhang for ITC Hotels and a buying opportunity in IndiGo despite short-term turbulence.

items.title: IndiGo flight cancellations at Mumbai Airport: India's largest airline cancels all flights
items.summary: IndiGo, India’s largest airline, has cancelled all domestic flights from Delhi and Mumbai, along with hundreds of other cancellations across Bengaluru, Goa, and other cities, intensifying its ongoing operational crisis. The disruptions, now in their fourth day, are due to new DGCA pilot rest rules, technology glitches, and planning gaps, leaving passengers stranded for hours with minimal communication, food, or water.

items.title: RBI’s repo rate cut set to drive affordable, mid-income housing demand
items.summary: The latest cut takes the cumulative reduction in repo rates to 125 basis points this year, reinforcing a supportive financing environment and strengthening sales momentum in the residential real estate sector, which has been on a sustained growth trajectory.

items.title: RBI cuts repo rate, raises GDP, lowers inflation – Ajay Bagga calls it ‘pragmatic & courageous’
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) bi-monthly monetary policy announcement on December 5 has drawn positive reactions from market experts, with veteran Ajay Bagga calling it fully in line with expectations.

items.title: Small-cap stock Diamond Power rises 5% on  ₹748 crore order from Adani Green Energy
items.summary: Diamond Power Infrastructure's shares rose 5% to  ₹150 following a significant order from Adani Green Energy for cable supply worth  ₹748 crore. This marks the second major order in a month, despite a 23% decline in share value since July's peak.

items.title: India's steel exports to Europe set to drop as EU carbon tax looms
items.summary: Indian steel exports to Europe will likely decrease as the European Union's carbon tax begins next month. Mills are now exploring new markets in Africa and the Middle East to compensate for this shift. The new levy aims to reduce carbon emissions.

items.title: Wockhardt shares bounce back 4% after two-day slump
items.summary: Wockhardt shares on December 1 jumped 19% after the US FDA accepted the company’s New Drug Application for Zaynich, its first-in-class antibiotic. But the rally cooled over the next two days as investors booked profits, leading to back-to-back 5% drops.

items.title: RBI cuts repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25% as inflation provides a headroom
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee has reduced its key repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%. This move comes as inflation projections are softer and growth estimates for the fiscal year are higher. The central bank aims to support economic activity while maintaining stability. Open market operations will inject liquidity into the banking system.

items.title: RBI Monetary Policy: Consumption, financials to lead rally, says Gurmeet Chadha; another 25-bp cut expected
items.summary: RBI Monetary Policy: Chadha said the tone of the policy clearly favours banking and financial stocks. He noted that transmission in loan rates has now reached about 64–65 paise, compared to around 50 per cent during the previous policy review. On the deposit side, he said transmission is almost complete, giving the RBI more room to cut rates going forward.

items.title: Sebi bars finfluencer Avadhut Sathe from markets, impounds  ₹546 crore for illegal gains from unregistered services
items.summary: Avadhut Sathe's academy allegedly misled over 337,000 investors, promising unrealistic returns through social media influence, and must respond to potential penalties within 21 days.

items.title: IndiGo chaos in Chennai: Airport issues list of all flights cancelled today
items.summary: IndiGo cancellations Chennai airport: In the first week of December, IndiGo -- India’s largest airline -- has faced a never-before-seen operational crisis marked by widespread flight cancellations and delays. The disruption has not only affected thousands and thousands of passengers across India, but has also drawn regulatory scrutiny and shaken investor confidence in the airline.

items.title: RBI to infuse  ₹1.45 trillion liquidity through bond buys, dollar-rupee swaps
items.summary: RBI's liquidity infusion will be through a mix of open market operation purchases of  ₹1 trillion and another  ₹45,000 crore through a three-year US dollar-rupee swap.

items.title: ITC Hotels block deal overhang set to end; strong room addition pipeline to drive upside: Prashant Biyani
items.summary: ITC Hotels’ upcoming block deal is unlikely to hurt the stock, says Elara Securities’ Prashant Biyani, who expects strong demand and room additions to drive upside. With aggressive expansion via management contracts, improving margins, and favourable hospitality sector trends, valuations still offer comfort. Key risks remain limited to any future slowdown in travel demand.

items.title: Explained: Will RBI’s $5 billion forex swap push the rupee lower?
items.summary: The RBI’s $5-billion forex swap and Rs 1 lakh crore in bond purchases mark a major liquidity infusion aimed at reinforcing rate cuts and easing pressure on a weak rupee. While the move may trigger short-term softness in the currency, economists say it boosts credit flow and gives the RBI more flexibility to manage volatility amid weak inflows and heightened speculative positions.

items.title: Bitcoin slips nearly 2% to $92K, Ethereum shows breakout cues around $3,200
items.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum experienced slight declines, trading around $92,000 and $3,158 respectively, as the broader crypto market capitalization dipped. While major altcoins saw significant drops, Tron rose. Analysts suggest Bitcoin is consolidating near resistance, with Ethereum showing signs of a potential breakout driven by accumulation, though altcoins are currently lagging.

items.title: Banks and NBFCs remain healthy, credit to commercial sector rises, says RBI Governor
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India reported robust financial parameters for banks and non-banking finance companies, facilitating increased resource flow to the commercial sector. Capital adequacy and asset quality remain strong, with credit growth bolstered by greater non-bank intermediation and sustained lending to various segments.

items.title: Sensex jumps over 300 points, Nifty 50 above 26,100 after RBI cuts repo rate by 25 bps
items.summary: Stock market today: Rate-sensitive sectors led the gains, with Nifty Realty, Nifty Auto, Nifty Financial Services, Nifty PSU Banks and the Nifty IT indices trading in the green.

items.title: China's Nvidia-like Moore Threads surges 500% on debut, becomes second-biggest listing pop of 2025
items.summary: Moore Threads, a Beijing-based GPU manufacturer, made a strong market today, with shares debuting 468% to 650 yuan. The IPO raised 8 billion yuan, signaling investor confidence in China's tech policies despite U.S. sanctions. The company aims for significant revenue growth and profitability by 2027.

items.title: HCC shares crack over 8% on record date for Rs 1,000 crore rights issue
items.summary: Hindustan Construction Company (HCC) shares dropped as the stock turned ex-rights ahead of its ₹999.99-crore rights issue. The company will issue up to 79.99 crore shares at ₹12.50 each, in a ratio of 277 rights shares for every 630 held. The offer opens on December 12 and closes on December 22, with rights renunciation allowed until December 17 (on-market) and December 19 (off-market).

items.title: Traders ignore Kaynes Tech clarification on governance concerns as shares crash another 6%
items.summary: Kaynes Technology shares fell sharply on Friday as investors remained unconvinced by the company’s detailed clarification on governance and accounting concerns flagged by Kotak and Investec. Despite management assurances, issues around related-party disclosures, working capital stress, and reliance on acquisitions continued to weigh on sentiment.

items.title: AI and technology tackling India’s growing stroke crisis: Early detection and prevention take centre stage
items.summary: India faces a mounting crisis with a 51% rise in stroke cases over the last 30 years, recording 1.25 million new strokes in 2021 alone. Yet only a quarter of Indians have access to stroke-ready hospitals. Doctors at the Medtronic X EconomicTimes.com “Stroke Pe Rok” webinar agreed that creating awareness, improving primary care screening, and leveraging emerging technology must become urgent priorities to save lives and reduce stroke burden in India.

items.title: RBI Monetary Policy Meet Today: Repo Rate, GDP, Inflation – 10 key takeaways from today’s MPC meet
items.summary: RBI Monetary Policy Meet Today: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) concluded its three-day Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) review, delivering several important updates on growth, inflation, and liquidity measures. Here are the 10 key takeaways from today’s announcement:

items.title: AI Valuations Are in the Bubble Zone, but the Technology Is Real: Jiraaf Co-Founder Vineet Agrawal
items.summary: Jiraaf Co-Founder Vineet Agrawal warns that while AI technology is real and transformative, many AI-linked company valuations are entering bubble territory. He advises investors against heavily indexing portfolios to a few select US AI stocks due to valuation compression risk, suggesting a diversified approach.

items.title: Asit Bhandarkar advises basket approach for investors amid improving valuations
items.summary: Investors should be selective in exports, financials, and midcaps. Textiles, pharmaceuticals, and IT offer potential. Private and PSU banks show promise with credit growth. Midcaps and smallcaps are showing earnings recovery. Festive season demand is expected to boost future performance. Opportunities exist for long-term investors.

items.title: Young shoppers fuel growth as brands turn to AI amid tariff pressures
items.summary: Young consumers are boosting sales for brands like Warby Parker, Tapestry, and The Honest Company. Despite higher prices, younger shoppers are still buying essential items and accessories. Artificial intelligence is also improving company efficiency and profits. Executives shared these insights at the Reuters NEXT conference, looking ahead to 2026. This trend offers a positive outlook for brands navigating economic challenges.

items.title: RBI Monetary Policy Meeting Today: RBI lifts GDP forecast, Trims inflation, Cuts repo rate to 5.25% — What changes for FY26?
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) delivered its bi-monthly monetary policy announcement after the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) concluded its three-day review.

items.title: Sitharaman, Russia’s Manturov discuss investment opportunities
items.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin is currently in the capital for a summit

items.title: IndiGo flights from Delhi & Mumbai come to a halt while Chennai, Bengaluru sputters; shares in air pocket
items.summary: IndiGo has cancelled all Delhi departures until midnight due to ongoing internal operational challenges, leading to widespread nationwide disruptions. Over 400 flights were cancelled on Friday alone, with significant delays at major airports. The airline is seeking a two-month exemption from new duty-time rules to restore stable operations by February 10, 2026.

items.title: RBI cuts repo rate by 0.25%; Sanjay Malhotra outlines GDP, inflation projections
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points, bringing it down to 5.25 per cent. The decision was announced by RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra following the conclusion of the three-day Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting held from December 3 to 5.

items.title: US affordability squeeze eases slightly as key delinquency metrics stabilize
items.summary: Despite fears of an affordability crisis, US consumer delinquency indicators show surprising resilience. While some metrics are elevated, credit card delinquencies are stabilizing, and overall debt servicing remains historically low. Strong wage growth offers a buffer, suggesting household finances might be weathering the storm better than anticipated, though student loan defaults pose a risk.

items.title: Why RBI MPC cut key rates today amid tricky growth-inflation mix
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India cut the repo rate by 25 basis points, bringing it to 5.25%, citing record-low retail inflation and a supportive price outlook. With this move, the MPC has reduced rates by 125 basis points since February, while maintaining a neutral policy stance.

items.title: Vidya Wires IPO Day 3: GMP movement, strong demand. Will you participate?
items.summary: Vidya Wires’ Rs 300-crore IPO entered its final bidding day with strong demand, after subscriptions hit 8.26 times and GMP improved to 10.6%. Robust retail and NII participation, attractive valuations, and sector tailwinds position the company favourably, with a potential listing price near Rs 57.5 per share.

items.title: 'Misleading': Centre refutes report on new $2-billion nuclear submarine deal with Russia
items.summary: Over the past two years, bilateral trade has grown substantially. During Putin’s visit, discussions will focus on boosting Indian exports and developing new models of partnership.

items.title: Gold prices slip below Rs 1.3 lakh, silver rises after 2-day decline. Traders cautious ahead of Fed outcome?
items.summary: Gold prices slipped below Rs 1.3 lakh on MCX even as silver rebounded after a two-day decline, with traders turning cautious ahead of key U.S. inflation data and the Fed policy outcome. Global gold remained steady as higher Treasury yields and a firm dollar capped gains, keeping market sentiment mixed.

items.title: RBI rate cut: Rate-sensitive sectors soar, Nifty realty jumps 1%, Bank Nifty, auto index also in green
items.summary: The RBI's MPC cut the repo rate to 5.25% amid low inflation at 2.2%. The central bank raised FY26 GDP growth estimate to 7.3% and reduced CPI inflation to 2%. Following the announcement, Indian stocks gained, with the Nifty Bank index and other rate-sensitive sectors reacting positively.

items.title: Why IndiGo flights are getting cancelled, when the situation may return to normal, and how you can prepare: Here are some answers
items.summary: IndiGo flight cancellations news: IndiGo faces widespread flight cancellations and delays, stranding thousands due to new DGCA pilot duty rules. The airline cites operational challenges, but pilot federations blame IndiGo's lean staffing and late preparation for the ongoing chaos, impacting services for the third consecutive day.

items.title: RBI Rate Cut Impact on Stock Market: Banks, NBFCs, Auto & Realty shine up to 2%
items.summary: RBI rate cut impact on Stock Market: Market breadth was strong in the banking space, with 10 of 12 stocks advancing. Among the top gainers, AU Small Finance Bank jumped 12.65 points to 961.40, IDFC First Bank rose 0.88 points to 80.76, and PNB added 1.16 points to 120.69. Kotak Mahindra Bank climbed 16.60 points to 2,152.00, while HDFC Bank gained 4.40 points to 1,001.60. ICICI Bank was up 6 points to 1,392.70, Canara Bank surged 0.56 points to 147.95, and Federal Bank added 0.95 points to 259.60.

items.title: Rupee plunges past  ₹90: How the all-time low will hit 5 vital aspects of your life
items.summary: The article explains how rupee depreciation past  ₹90 affects daily life by raising fuel costs, inflating import prices, straining overseas expenses and increasing economic pressure on households and businesses.

items.title: Consumption, Quick Commerce and Financials: Asit Bhandarkar on where investors should focus
items.summary: Asit Bhandarkar identifies consumption, financials, and exporters as prime investment areas.  Consumption is seen as a medium-term growth story. Financials offer attractive valuations and pristine asset quality. Exporters may also present opportunities.  Investors are advised a balanced approach to navigate the current market complexities.

items.title: Aequs IPO Day 3: Why 15 brokerages are bullish despite premium valuations
items.summary: Aequs’ IPO gains strong backing from brokerages despite losses, driven by its integrated aerospace manufacturing capabilities and long-standing global clients. Risks persist in non-core segments, but most analysts see long-term value supported by debt reduction, capex upgrades and strong order visibility.

items.title: RBI monetary policy: GDP growth projection raised to 7.3% for current fiscal
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI), on December 5, raised its GDP growth projection for FY2026 to 7.3%, up from its earlier estimate of 6.8%.

items.title: RBI MPC 2025: Rupee firms as forex reserves rise to $686 billion
items.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves have climbed to $686 billion. This provides a strong 11 months of import cover. The Reserve Bank of India announced a 25-basis point cut in the repo rate to 5.25%. The rupee also saw an appreciation against the US dollar.

items.title: RBI to pump liquidity with $5 billion forex swap as rupee stays under pressure
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, marking a total reduction of 125 bps since February 2025. This move, supported by liquidity measures like bond purchases and a dollar-rupee swap, aims to bolster economic growth amid cooling inflation. The decision was unanimous, with Governor Malhotra citing favorable economic conditions.

items.title: BPCL buys Russian Urals, CPC from non-sanctioned entities, sources say
items.summary: State-run Bharat Petroleum Corp has ordered 2 million barrels each of Russian Urals and CPC Blend oil for January loading from non-sanctioned suppliers. The deals were secured at a discount of $6-$7 per barrel to dated Brent, with CPC Blend primarily sourced from Kazakhstan.

items.title: RBI Policy Today: Will Banks, NBFCs and Realty stocks explode if rates are cut? Anil Singhvi’s big outlook
items.summary: A softer policy stance with hints of future easing could support credit demand, lower funding costs and improve housing affordability. Shares of HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, State Bank of India, Axis Bank, Bajaj Finance, Cholamandalam Investment and Finance Company, Canara Bank, Federal Bank, IDFC First Bank and Shriram Finance are expected to remain active through the session.

items.title: Park Medi World fixes price band of Rs 154-Rs 162 for its IPO, bids open December 10. Check details
items.summary: Park Medi World is launching its Initial Public Offering. The company has set a price band of Rs 154 to Rs 162 per share. This offering aims to raise Rs 770 crore through new shares. Existing shareholders will also sell shares worth Rs 150 crore. The subscription period opens on December 10 and closes on December 12.

items.title: CAMS shares plunge 41% in early trade! Here’s why investors shouldn’t worry
items.summary: CAMS shares dropped 41% in early trade as the stock began trading ex-split following its 1:5 split, reducing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 2. The steep fall is a routine technical adjustment reflecting the increased share count, with no impact on fundamentals. The split aims to boost liquidity and enhance retail participation.

items.title: Cristiano Ronaldo invests in Perplexity AI, announces brand collaboration for digital hub — What we know
items.summary: Perplexity AI announced a global partnership with sports star Cristiano Ronaldo, focusing on a digital hub that showcases his football career. The footballer is also an investor in the AI company.

items.title: RBI Policy: Rate-sensitive banking, NBFC, auto and realty stocks gain up to 2% after 25 bps repo rate cut
items.summary: Banking, NBFC, auto, and realty stocks saw gains of up to 2% on Friday following the Reserve Bank of India's 25 basis point repo rate cut. This move, aligning with expectations, was driven by record-low retail inflation and a stable price outlook, aiming to bolster economic growth.

items.title: Are trillion-dollar valuations for Nvidia and AI giants built on fairy tale? Aswath Damodaran decodes
items.summary: Valuation guru Aswath Damodaran questions if trillion-dollar market caps, particularly Nvidia's, are driven by genuine performance or investor fantasy. He uses a 'possible, plausible, probable' framework to assess Nvidia's revenue needs and warns of the 'Big Market Delusion' in AI, where aggregate valuations outstrip realistic revenue potential.

items.title: RBI Inflation FY2025-26: MPC slashes inflation aim by 60 bps to 2% as food prices ease
items.summary: RBI Inflation 2025-26: The Reserve Bank of India has lowered its inflation projection for the fiscal year 2025-26 to 2%. This comes as inflationary pressures ease due to GST rate cuts and improved supply conditions. The central bank also significantly raised its GDP growth forecast for the same period to 7.3%, signalling a positive economic outlook.

items.title: RBI MPC Policy: Central bank revises inflation estimate downwards to 2% for FY26
items.summary: RBI MPC Policy: The RBI's MPC cut the policy repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, maintaining a neutral stance. Inflation forecasts for 2025-2026 were revised down to 2%. Open market operations of  ₹1 lakh crore are planned, with the next MPC meeting scheduled for February 2026.

items.title: Global hedge funds outpace major indexes with 15% returns in 2025
items.summary: Global hedge funds are ending 2025 on a strong footing, delivering nearly 15% returns through November, driven by stock pickers, quant strategies, and a standout rally in healthcare. While long-short equity funds outperformed major U.S. indices, TMT-focused funds lagged due to a tech sell-off. Regionally, managers remained bullish on North America, added exposure to Japan, and pared positions in Europe and Hong Kong.

items.title: Adani, Hindalco seek Peru copper assets as demand surges
items.summary: Indian companies Adani and Hindalco Industries are looking to invest in Peru's copper sector. Peru, a major copper producer, is seeking new investments. India, a growing economy, wants to secure its copper supply chains. Discussions are underway for a free trade agreement between India and Peru. This pact could ensure a fixed quantity of copper concentrate for India.

items.title: RBI GDP Growth 2025: Central bank raises FY26 growth forecast to 7.3%
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India’s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has raised India’s GDP growth forecast for FY2025-26 to 7.3%, up from 6.8%, following stronger-than-expected economic performance. In the July–September quarter, GDP grew 8.2%, a six-quarter high driven by robust consumer demand boosted by GST rate cuts. The economy grew 6.5% in FY25.

items.title: Delhi Airport issues advisory as IndiGo faces large-scale flight disruptions
items.summary: IndiGo is facing severe operational disruptions, leading to mass flight cancellations and delays at Delhi Airport. The airline attributes the issues to implementing new Flight Duty Time Limitations rules and crew scheduling constraints. The Civil Aviation Minister has held an emergency meeting, and the DGCA is monitoring the situation and airfares.

items.title: Meesho IPO Day 3: Issue subscribed 10 times, high GMP. Should you subscribe?
items.summary: Meesho IPO: The company has priced its issue at ₹105–111 per share and is pitching itself as a fast-growing, low-cost marketplace with deep reach in India’s Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹4,250 crore and an offer for sale worth ₹1,171.20 crore.

items.title: RBI monetary policy: A 25 bps rate cut; growth, inflation forecast revised— 5 key highlights from RBI MPC outcome
items.summary: RBI monetary policy: The rate cut by the RBI MPC came as a surprise for many, as a majority of experts expected the central bank to maintain the status quo on rates in December.

items.title: RBI Policy: MPC cuts repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25%
items.summary: RBI Policy: A Mint poll of 13 economists showed that nine expected a pause in the repo rate, while four had anticipated a 25-basis point cut to 5.25%.

items.title: RBI MPC cuts repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25%, maintains neutral stance; revises GDP, inflation forecast for FY26
items.summary: Latest Monetary Policy Committee meeting updates: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee cut the policy repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, maintaining a neutral stance. This decision follows a significant drop in inflation to a multi-decade low and robust GDP growth of 8.2% in Q2 FY2026. The move aims to provide monetary support amidst favorable economic conditions.

items.title: Diagnostic stocks shine on strong Q2; midcap IT outperforms but valuations remain stretchy: Sunny Agrawal
items.summary: Diagnostic companies delivered strong Q2 earnings driven by volume growth and deeper penetration, says SBI Cap Securities’ Sunny Agrawal. Midcap IT continues to outperform on rupee tailwinds and easing global uncertainty, though valuations remain high. Agrawal expects the RBI to pause rate cuts and advises caution on richly valued Kaynes Technology amid governance concerns.

items.title: RBI MPC Meeting: Top key takeaways from RBI’s latest policy
items.summary: RBI MPC Key Takeaways: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced the repo rate to 5.25%. This move supports economic growth. The central bank has also upgraded its GDP forecast to 7.3%. Inflation has fallen significantly, providing room for monetary easing. The RBI is taking steps to ensure liquidity in the market. The Indian rupee has shown recovery against the US dollar.

items.title: Biocon among 6 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.summary: Six F&O stocks, including Biocon, saw a sharp rise in futures open interest on December 4, signalling a fresh build-up in derivatives positions.

items.title: Mint Explainer | Can 72,000 public chargers fix India’s slow EV adoption?
items.summary: With only 29,000 public chargers today, India’s push to add 72,000 more raises a bigger question: will the infrastructure keep pace with accelerating EV demand?

items.title: IndiGo cancels over 400 flights at various airports on Friday, shares in red
items.summary: IndiGo cancelled over 400 flights on Friday. Hundreds of passengers faced long delays at airports across India. Delhi, Bangalore, and Hyderabad airports reported significant cancellations. The airline is facing operational disruptions. IndiGo expects flight operations to stabilize by February 10, 2026. The civil aviation ministry and DGCA are monitoring the situation.

items.title: India Cements among 5 stocks closed crossing above VWAP
items.summary: Five Nifty500 stocks — including India Cements — closed over 1% above their VWAP, signalling a potential bullish trend.

items.title: Priyanka Chaturvedi requests Civil Aviation Minister to make statement in Rajya Sabha on IndiGo flight disruptions
items.summary: IndiGo has been experiencing a sharp rise in cancellations, reaching approximately 170-200 flights per day, substantially higher than usual.

items.title: Nifty to hit 29,000 in 2026, BofA lists 7 reasons why
items.summary: Bank of America Securities forecasts the Nifty 50 to surge to 29,000 by 2026, driven by robust earnings growth. Analysts point to stabilizing earnings estimates, a supportive macro environment, and potential reversal of foreign investor outflows as key drivers.  Steady domestic inflows are also expected to bolster market valuations.

items.title: Rupee firms near 89.72, traders tread gingerly as RBI decision looms
items.summary: The Indian rupee showed strength early Friday, recovering above 90 per dollar as traders awaited the central bank's policy decision. Despite expectations of a rate cut, market sentiment shifted due to strong economic data and the rupee's recent dip. Exporters are advised to sell dollars, while importers should buy on dips, as a clear trend reversal isn't anticipated.

items.title: Add these four fundamentally strong stocks under  ₹100 to your 2026 watch list
items.summary: While many penny stocks are too risky to invest in, a few stand out with solid fundamentals and stable business models. Tracking such names early can open the door to potential long-term opportunities, but make sure you can stomach wild swings before investing.

items.title: Stocks to buy: Rajesh Palviya of Axis Sec suggests L&T Tech, Torrent Pharma, JK Tyre shares today
items.summary: Indian stock market opened lower with mixed investor sentiments on the RBI's policy decision. The Nifty 50 and Sensex saw slight declines. Strong economic growth and low inflation are impacting rate cut expectations, while some stocks show bullish momentum.

items.title: EV poster boy Ola’s 64% crash is worst among peers - stock now half its IPO price. Is the selloff over yet?
items.summary: Ola Electric shares plunged to a new lifetime low, losing over half their IPO value and significantly underperforming the booming auto sector. The company faces declining market share, persistent losses, and controversies. Analysts see continued downside, though some suggest a wait-and-watch approach for investors with high risk appetite, citing potential for a rebound similar to other beaten-down stocks.

items.title: Rupee firms, traders tread gingerly as RBI decision looms
items.summary: INDIA-MARKETS/RUPEE (UPDATE 1):INDIA RUPEE-Rupee firms, traders tread gingerly as RBI decision looms

items.title: Sensex, Nifty off to flat start as Dalal Street braces for RBI rate decision
items.summary: Indian stock markets began Friday trading with caution. The Sensex and Nifty showed little movement as investors awaited the Reserve Bank of India's policy announcement. This comes after a brief recovery on Thursday. Strong economic growth and a weakening rupee are influencing expectations. The Sensex saw a small gain, and the Nifty also opened higher.

items.title: RBI MPC at a glance: Your one-stop guide for all key decisions
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% to support economic growth, with inflation at a record low. GDP growth is projected at 7.3% for 2025-26, while CPI inflation is forecast at 2.0%.

items.title: RBI MPC meet highlights: From India’s 'goldilocks moment’ to rate cut, here’s what RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra said today
items.summary: The RBI, citing a "Goldilocks moment" with 8% growth and 2.2% inflation, cut the repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25%. This move aims to support economic momentum, with inflation projected to remain subdued. The MPC anticipates continued growth driven by various domestic factors, despite external headwinds.

items.title: IndiGo shares drop 3% amid flight fiasco. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.summary: IndiGo is facing significant operational disruptions, leading to over 300 daily flight cancellations due to new pilot duty-hour regulations. The airline has requested a two-month exemption from specific night duty rules from the DGCA, aiming to restore stable operations by February 10, 2026.

items.title: Simone Tata, Lakmé founder and mother of Noel Tata, passes away at 95
items.summary: Simone Tata, mother of Noel Tata and stepmother of Ratan Tata, passed away in Mumbai. She was a pioneering business leader who transformed Lakmé into a prominent cosmetics brand before its sale to Hindustan Unilever in the 1990s.

items.title: HUL demerger record date today: What it means for shareholders & key details to know
items.summary: Hindustan Unilever's ice-cream business, Kwality Wall's, is officially spinning off today, December 5th, with shareholders set to receive new shares. This strategic move aims to unlock value by creating a standalone entity for its rapidly growing ice-cream vertical.  The newly formed company is expected to list on the stock exchange in February 2026.

items.title: Gold price today: Rates rise after RBI monetary policy decision; experts highlight key levels to watch on MCX
items.summary: MCX gold February contracts were 0.25% up at  ₹1,30,407 per 10 grams around 11 am. MCX silver March contracts were up 1.44% at  ₹1,80,700 per kg at that time.

items.title: Aequs Ltd IPO GMP Live Updates: Issue booked 28x so far. GMP hints 33% listing pop. Check price band, subscription status and other key details
Aequs IPO Day 3: Issue sees strong GMP and 11x subscription; should you apply?
items.summary: Aequs’ Rs 921-crore IPO, priced at Rs 118–124, is open from December 3–5, 2025, with listing expected on December 10. The precision engineering firm, which reported higher losses in FY25, has strong OEM partnerships and a vertically integrated model. Analysts largely recommend subscribing, citing entry barriers, robust order books, and attractive valuations despite near-term profitability concerns.

items.title: Apple exec shake-up continues, onboards Meta's chief legal officer Jennifer Newstead as new general counsel
items.summary: Apple Inc. hired Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Legal Officer Jennifer Newstead as its general counsel, part of a wave of executive changes at the iPhone maker.

items.title: In India's mining belt, women spark hope with solar lamps
items.summary: Santosh Devi is proud to have brought light -- and hope -- to her hamlet in western India, taking up solar engineering through a programme for women like her whose husbands suffer chronic disease from mining work. With their sick husbands out of work, the training has allowed these women to make a living and support their families.

items.title: Meesho IPO Day 3 LIVE: Issue booked 26.87x so far. GMP hints 45% listing pop. Should you subscribe or skip?
items.summary: Meesho IPO Day 3 LIVE: Meesho IPO price band is set at  ₹105 to  ₹111 per share, with subscriptions from December 3-5. The company aims to raise  ₹4,250 cr, focusing on cloud infrastructure and marketing, and has reduced its losses significantly this year. Meesho IPO GMP today stands at  ₹49.5.

items.title: Indian IT to see only mid-single digit growth in 2026 as macro outlook stays flat: Fitch Ratings
items.summary: Fitch Ratings expects Indian IT services to post mid-single digit revenue growth in 2026 as global macro conditions remain flat and discretionary tech spending stays weak. BFSI demand remains steady, but consumer, retail and manufacturing lag. Fitch says Indian IT is well positioned for AI-led enterprise transformation, while GCC expansion heightens talent competition and wage pressures.

items.title: Vidya Wires IPO Day 3: Issue subscribed over 19x till now; check latest GMP here - Should you apply?
items.summary: Vidya Wires IPO opened on December 3 and will close today, raising  ₹300.01 crore. The shares are priced between  ₹48 and  ₹52, with a strong investor interest. The IPO was subscribed 8.94x by Day 2, indicating robust demand.

items.title: ITC Hotels shares slide 2% after BAT offloads Rs 3,856 crore stake in block deal
items.summary: ITC Hotels shares dipped Friday as British American Tobacco (BAT) reportedly sold a 9% stake for approximately Rs 3,856 crore. This move aligns with BAT's strategy to reduce debt and achieve its 2026 financial targets. BAT CEO confirmed the holding wasn't strategic, acquired during the hotel business demerger from ITC Limited.

items.title: Meesho IPO day 3: GMP jumps! Subscription status, date, price to review. Apply or not?
items.summary: Meesho IPO GMP today: According to market observers, shares of Meesho Ltd are available at a premium of  ₹53 in the grey market today, which is  ₹2 higher than yesterday's premium of  ₹51

items.title: HUL shares decline 7% on record date for ice cream business demerger
items.summary: Hindustan Unilever Ltd (HUL) has set December 5, 2025, as the record date for the demerger of its ice-cream business into Kwality Wall’s (India) Limited (KWIL). This strategic move aims to unlock value by separating the high-growth ice-cream segment. The demerger is scheduled to be effective December 1, 2025, with KWIL expected to list in February 2026.

items.title: Aequs IPO Day 3: Issue booked 42.52x so far. GMP hints 33% listing gain. Check key dates, review. Apply or not?
items.summary: Aequs IPO, focusing on consumer goods and aerospace components, saw an 11.10x subscription by day two. The IPO price band is  ₹118-124, with an estimated listing price of  ₹165, reflecting a 33.06% premium.

items.title: Bharti Airtel among 4 Nifty stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.summary: “RSI trending up” indicates that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) is rising, suggesting strengthening price momentum.

items.title: RIL shares in focus as S&P Global upgrades rating to 'A-' on cash flow stability
items.summary: Reliance Industries' credit rating has been upgraded to 'A-' by S&P Global Ratings, citing improved cash flow stability and a strong earnings outlook driven by its consumer-facing businesses. The agency anticipates prudent financial management and expects earnings growth to outpace high capital expenditure, maintaining a stable outlook.

items.title: Compass Diversified Looks to Cut Debt in ‘Most Challenging’ Time
items.summary: Private equity firm Compass Diversified said Thursday it’s exploring whether to sell some businesses to reduce debt, as it prepares to restate financials after alleged fraud at its high-end jewelry subsidiary.

items.title: Nifty 50 to be around 26,200 by December-end, says Jimeet Modi; suggests long-term investors to buy small-caps on dips
items.summary: Jimeet Modi, CEO of SAMCO Group, anticipates Nifty will remain range-bound, with a possible movement of ±500 points by December and ±1,000 points by March 2026. He suggests focusing on large caps for stability while long-term investors should accumulate quality small caps on dips.

items.title: Russia's Rosatom delivers nuclear fuel to Kudankulam plant
items.summary: Russia's state nuclear corporation has delivered the initial nuclear fuel for the third reactor at India's Kudankulam plant. This marks a significant step in expanding the plant's capacity. The delivery coincides with Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to New Delhi.

items.title: India, Oman hold 14th Strategic Consultative Group meeting
items.summary: India and Oman held their 14th Strategic Consultative Group meeting in Muscat. Discussions covered political, defense, security, trade, and cultural ties. Both nations reaffirmed their commitment to deepening bilateral cooperation. The next meeting will be held in New Delhi.

items.title: Rupee likely to inch up ahead of RBI decision after recovery tempers bearish run
items.summary: INDIA-MARKETS/RUPEE:INDIA RUPEE-Rupee likely to inch up ahead of RBI decision after recovery tempers bearish run

items.title: Stocks to buy or sell: From Aurobindo Pharma to UPL— Ajit Mishra of Religare Broking shares strategies for 3 names
items.summary: Ajit Mishra from Religare Broking provides a strategic analysis of three stocks in the Indian market, suggesting Aurobindo Pharma and UPL as buys while recommending a sell for Bandhan Bank futures.&nbsp;
