items.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy announced significant development plans for Adilabad district. The new Adilabad airport will be completed within a year, with Airbus services to follow. A new university will also be established. The Chief Minister emphasized strengthening irrigation, education, and communication facilities.

items.title: Formulations driving drug export growth: Pharmexcil chairman Namit Joshi
items.summary: Indian pharmaceutical exports are set to reach a new high of $32 billion this fiscal year. This growth is driven by formulations, especially in Europe, Africa, and Latin America. Despite challenges in the US market and global quality checks, the industry shows resilience. Steady demand and normalizing supply chains support this positive outlook.

items.title: Formulations driving drug export growth: Pharmexcil chairman Namit Joshi
items.summary: Indian pharmaceutical exports are set to reach a new high of $32 billion this fiscal year. This growth is driven by formulations, especially in Europe, Africa, and Latin America. Despite challenges in the US market and global quality checks, the industry shows resilience. Steady demand and normalizing supply chains support this positive outlook.

items.title: The path to a greener electricity grid may be paved with good intentions but we mustn’t set targets in stone
items.summary: Solar and wind capacity in India have been on the rise. However, moving to cleaner electricity is a highly complex challenge that calls for optimal costs and a broadly equitable market. Some flexibility in target setting would ease the country’s path.

items.title: HUL Demerger LIVE Updates: HUL share recovers, now down 3% after a 7% drop earlier as Kwality Wall’s demerger kicks in
items.summary: HUL Demerger LIVE Updates: Hindustan Unilever demerger record date is today, 5 December 2025. From today, HUL shares will trade ex-ice cream business, Kwality Wall’s (India). As per the scheme, the FMCG major will transfer all its ice-cream brands to the newly formed entity.

items.title: Making of luxury car: Not just price, time & experience matter too
items.summary: New car prices are soaring, with luxury vehicles driving the increase. Carmakers are now redefining luxury. It's not just about cost or fancy materials. Brands are building communities and respecting buyers' time. Personalization and exclusive access to leadership are key. This shift focuses on customer experience and individual preferences.

items.title: GSK India plans big 'reinvention', MD Bhushan Akshikar reveals
items.summary: GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals is planning a major comeback in India. The company aims to double its revenue to ₹8,000 crore within the next 4-5 years. This growth will be driven by a strategic shift towards specialty drugs in oncology and liver diseases. Adult vaccination is also a key focus area.

items.title: India bucks global trend, traditional media is set to touch $22.9 bn by 2029: PwC report
items.summary: India's media and entertainment sector is booming, outpacing global trends. Both digital and traditional media are expanding significantly. Digital media is the fastest growing segment, driven by internet advertising and OTT streaming. Traditional media, including television and print, also shows robust growth. The gaming industry is adapting to new formats.

items.title: Smartphones turn dearer as memory chip prices surge
items.summary: Smartphone memory prices are surging, forcing brands to raise device costs. Storage and memory module prices will continue to climb through 2026. This impacts demand, especially for budget smartphones.  Brands like Vivo, Oppo, and Realme are increasing prices on existing inventory and new launches.  This trend is expected to persist into the first half of next year.

items.title: Putin’s India visit: Can India-Russia bonhomie jeopardise the potential India-US trade deal? Experts debate
items.summary: As Russian President Vladimir Putin visits India, experts debate the potential implications for an India-US trade deal. The Russian President has stated that the India-Russia relationship is centred on safeguarding their mutual interests without harming others.

items.title: Govt may seek bids for $7 billion IDBI Bank stake this month
items.summary: India is preparing to invite bids for its 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank Ltd., valued at approximately $7.1 billion. This move is a significant step in the government's privatization efforts for the lender. Talks with potential suitors are advanced, with a formal bidding process expected soon.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Can any government really keep young teens off social media? All eyes are on Australia
items.summary: Australia expects to protect children with its social media ban that Meta has begun to comply with, but the internet rarely bends to rules. Social media is addictive—and that’s one reason under-16s may seek workarounds, potentially leaving us clueless of the ban’s efficacy.

items.title: Old silver turns source of new riches as consumers offload 100 tonnes of metal in one week
items.summary: Indians sold an estimated 100 tonnes of old silver in one week, driven by record-high prices and seasonal demand for cash. This surge, far exceeding typical monthly sales, indicates a significant profit-taking opportunity for households. Analysts predict further price increases due to a widening supply deficit.

items.title: RBI rate decision: Pause, cut — or just punt? Five signals to watch for today
items.summary: The RBI policy comes in the backdrop of record-low inflation, surprisingly strong real GDP numbers, weakening nominal growth and rising external risks. Here are five things to track in the policy

items.title: Byju Raveendran’s offshore footprint resurfaces in Aakash’s  ₹250-cr fundraise
items.summary: Byju Raveendran's indirect influence over Aakash through Beeaar Investco has cast doubt on the legality of the test-prep institution's latest rights issue.&nbsp;

items.title: VCs favour technologists, not hustlers, in India’s new AI, deep-tech wave
items.summary: Startups spun out of IITs, research labs, and patent-heavy teams are attracting more funding as investors prioritise technical depth over execution-first founders.

items.title: Microsoft plans bigger data centre investment in India beyond 2026, to keep hiring AI talent
items.summary: Ahead of Satya Nadella’s India visit, Microsoft’s Puneet Chandok said AI adoption is scaling fast, data centre investments will go beyond the $3 billion planned through 2026, and upskilling will shape future jobs.

items.title: Corporates usually wait for RBI rate decision before bond offers. Not this time
items.summary: Bond issuers are breaking from past trends to flood the market with paper amid uncertainty about a rate cut, a weakening rupee, and a high supply of central and state government debt.

items.title: Falling rupee should cheer exporters; so why is no one smiling?
items.summary: While a weaker rupee typically enhances export competitiveness, its 5% depreciation this year to become Asia's worst-performing currency is proving to be a weak cushion against the 50% punitive tariffs that the US president unleashed on key Indian goods in August.

items.title: Africa’s Croesus Aliko Dangote inspired by Reliance; now seeks to rival Jamnagar refinery
items.summary: Nigerian multi billionaire businessman, also the richest in Africa is hero to some and monopolist to others. He is seeking India Inc’s help again for ramp up his $20 billion Lagos complex biggest in world with throughput of 1.4 mn barrels a day.

items.title: Owner of NYC’s Fordham Landing Housing Project Files Bankruptcy
items.summary: The owner of Fordham Landing, a major housing development in the Bronx that’s attracted state investment, has filed bankruptcy to halt a foreclosure sale.

items.title: Faulty glucose monitors linked to 7 deaths and more than 700 injuries, FDA warns
items.summary: Faulty glucose monitors linked to 7 deaths and more than 700 injuries, FDA warns

items.title: Banker Bonus Pools Rise 15% at Canada’s Big Lenders in Busy Year
items.summary: Canada’s biggest lenders set aside 15% more for banker bonus pools in fiscal 2025, a year when the firms’ capital-markets divisions were more active on deals and US President Donald Trump’s policy swings kept trading desks busy.

items.title: 'State tenders to be key in RE capacity addition'
items.summary: "There are multiple routes and one of the primary instruments is going to be the tenders floated by the states," Sarangi said while addressing the session on energy transition at CII India Edge.

items.title: Road Ministry taps IIT-Kanpur to fix 'black spots' on highways to prevent accidents
items.summary: India's Ministry of Road Transport and Highways is partnering with IIT-Kanpur to leverage AI for identifying and analyzing high-risk road "black spots." This initiative aims to understand the root causes of repeated collisions on national highways and implement targeted solutions. The project seeks to improve accident data analysis and reporting to significantly reduce road crashes by 2030.

items.title: Toyota pitches for ethanol hybrids as India looks at electric future
items.summary: Offering tax relief and emission norm benefits to flex-fuel vehicles can help in pushing manufacturers to popularize such vehicles, Vikram Gulati, Toyota’s country head, told Mint.

items.title: Health & national security cess only on demerit goods like pan masala, not essentials, says Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: A new health and national security cess will be imposed on demerit goods like pan masala. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated this cess will not affect essential commodities. The collected revenue will create a dedicated fund for health and national security. This move aims to deter consumption of certain products. The bill has received parliamentary approval.

items.title: Sberbank plans to go big in India, move rupee surplus into G-Secs
items.summary: Sberbank, which processes the largest share of India-Russia trade payments, is also looking at channelling rupee surplus of its investors into government securities, said Herman Gref, CEO and chairman of the executive board. The bank is also considering the export of gold to India, having secured a licence to do so. It's also examining entry into the education and healthcare sectors.

items.title: India, Russia eye trade boost with more diversified basket
items.summary: India and Russia aim to double bilateral trade to $100 billion by 2030, focusing on diversifying exports beyond current levels. Both nations are actively seeking to address the significant trade imbalance, with New Delhi identifying opportunities in consumer goods, automobiles, and electronics. Russia is keen to increase India's share in its imports, offering support for Indian businesses.

items.title: Fitch raises FY26 growth forecast to 7.4% from 6.9%
items.summary: Fitch Ratings has boosted India's economic growth forecast for FY26 to 7.4 percent. This upgrade is driven by robust consumer spending and recent Goods and Services Tax reforms. The agency anticipates the Indian Rupee will strengthen against the dollar. Falling inflation provides room for the Reserve Bank of India to further reduce policy rates.

items.title: To become global reinsurance hub, GIFT City must offer global regularity clarity
items.summary: To be sure, GIFT City already extends several benefits to reinsurers seeking to make this an operational hub. It offers no additional capital injection requirement, a 10-year tax holiday, and significantly lighter staffing and regulatory obligations than onshore India, where full-fledged operations demand a CEO, CFO, chief compliance officer and strict key managerial personnel norms.

items.title: Suzlon unveils plan for three new AI-enabled smart blade units
items.summary: Suzlon Energy is launching three new AI-powered smart blade factories. This expansion will boost its manufacturing capabilities across India. The new facilities aim to improve blade quality and production efficiency. Suzlon is also upgrading its existing plants. This strategic move supports its large order book and strengthens its position in India's growing wind energy sector.

items.title: IndiGo to cut flights from December 8; targets full restoration by February 2026
items.summary: IndiGo will cut flights starting December 8. The airline expects to fully restore flight operations by February 10, 2026. This comes after recent disruptions. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation reviewed the situation with IndiGo officials. Planning gaps in Flight Duty Time Limitations norms caused crew requirement issues. More cancellations may occur soon.

items.title: Amazon Qcomm plans to have 300 dark stores by year-end
items.summary: Amazon is accelerating its 10-minute delivery push in India. The e-commerce giant is adding two dark stores daily. It plans to have 300 micro warehouses across Bengaluru, Mumbai, and Delhi-NCR by the end of this year. This expansion comes amid intense competition in the quick-commerce market.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh to get India's 1st 6 GW solar ingot-wafer unit
items.summary: India's first integrated 6 GW solar photovoltaic ingot and wafer manufacturing plant will be established in Anakapalli, Andhra Pradesh, by ReNew Photovoltaics. This ₹3,990 crore greenfield unit aims to reduce reliance on Chinese imports and bolster India's solar capacity targets. The project, supported by the PLI scheme, is expected to create 1,200 jobs and commence commercial production by January 2028.

items.title: Lenovo mobile phones, PCs clock 68% growth
items.summary: Lenovo Group witnessed a significant 68% surge in its Indian PC and mobile business last fiscal year, driven by a remarkable 150% jump in smartphone sales. The company's total consumer revenue reached ₹27,424 crore, with strong demand fueled by digitization, premiumization, and GST cuts. Lenovo India's profit after tax also saw a healthy 24% increase.

items.title: Working to reduce cascading impact of delays: IndiGo extends apology for flight disruptions
items.summary: India's largest airline, IndiGo, has apologized for widespread operational disruptions and delays over the past two days. The airline is collaborating with aviation authorities and airport operators to mitigate the cascading impact and restore normal operations. IndiGo advises customers to check flight status before traveling.

items.title: RBI scraps old lending curbs, downplays risk to corporate bond volumes
items.summary: The RBI repealed its 2016 guidelines limiting large borrowers' access to bank loans, and pushing them to borrow from the debt market. This change is expected to enhance corporate borrowing capacity, potentially allowing banks to lend an additional  ₹3-4.5 trillion.

items.title: IndiGo says it ‘misjudged’ new crew rules, assures full stability by 10 February
items.summary: The development follows unruly, chaotic scenes at airports nationwide on Thursday, as IndiGo struggled to manage irate travellers across airports. Protests broke out across terminals and fistfights were reported in Kolkata, prompting CISF intervention in Bengaluru and Mumbai.

items.title: Government proposes new spectrum sharing rule for telcos under new rules
items.summary: As per the illustration given in the latest draft rule, a service provider holding frequencies in a different band can share them with other operators having spectrum in a separate band but within the same category and telecom circle.

items.title: General Atlantic-backed ASG Eye Hospital eyes  ₹2,000 crore investment for expansion by 2030
items.summary: The Jodhpur-headquartered hospital chain has over 175 hospitals and 200 vision centres across more than 95 cities in India. It is planning to grow its centres to 600-700 in the next four years.

items.title: Brigade Enterprises expands Hyderabad footprint with  ₹477 crore land acquisition in Neopolis
items.summary: The acquisition was made at a price of  ₹118 crore per acre. This transaction represents a total investment of approximately  ₹477 crore and underscores Brigade's deep confidence in the city’s high-potential growth corridor and its strategic goal to scale operations in key metropolitan areas.

items.title: US trade team may visit India next week for talks
items.summary: The visit is crucial as India and the US are working to finalise the first tranche of the BTA amid Washington imposing 50% tariffs on India, of which 25% are penalty for buying Russian energy, effective August 27. So far, five rounds of trade talks have been completed for the BTA.

items.title: India-Russia ties remain time-tested and resilient: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Speaking at the India-Russia Business Summit, commerce minister Piyush Goyal acknowledged that the relationship is underpinned by deep cultural connections, citing classic Hindi films cherished in Russia.

items.title: IndiGo cancels over 550 domestic and international flights on Thursday
items.summary: IndiGo cancelled over 550 flights on Thursday amid operational disruptions, affecting domestic and international travel for hundreds of passengers. Punctuality dropped to 19.7 percent, down from 35 percent on Tuesday. The airline cited crew shortages and technical issues, and is implementing pre-planned cancellations while working to normalise operations, according to DGCA and company sources.

items.title: Dream11 pivots to sports entertainment, targets watch party experiences
items.summary: The company, with more than 250 million registered users on its platform, expects to capture a significant portion of the ‘watch party’ experience, or people watching streaming content, which India is likely to see explode in the sports segment.

items.title: India urges Russia to approve 32 seafood processing units for supplies
items.summary: India welcomed Russia’s approval of 128 seafood processing units for exports, calling it a sign of growing trust. Fisheries Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh urged Moscow to clear the remaining 32 units and lift temporary suspensions to further boost trade. Expanded access will benefit 30 million fishery-linked livelihoods, diversify exports, and strengthen India’s position as a leading global seafood producer.

items.title: Paramount raises Warner Bros breakup fee to $5 billion — who are the bidders in acquisition race?
items.summary: Paramount Skydance Corp has increased its breakup fee offer to $5 billion in its attempt to acquire Warner Bros Discovery Inc, signalling confidence in regulatory approval. Warner Bros is considering offers from two other bidders. Details here.

items.title: IndiGo flight disruptions: Aviation Minister instructs airline to normalize operations at the earliest
items.summary: Amid widespread disruptions across India, Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu has instructed IndiGo to normalize the operations at the earliest, adding that airport operators need to provide all the support to stranded passengers.

items.title: RBI issues amendments to update various regulations
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has amended the Large Exposures Framework and Intragroup Transactions guidelines, directing banks to manage concentration risks and monitor ultra-large borrowers. Additional amendments cover credit facilities for jewellers and require more frequent, accurate reporting of credit information from banks and NBFCs to Credit Information Companies, enhancing the quality and timeliness of data used for credit assessment and monitoring.

items.title: Retailers suggest a 'one nation, one retail licence' policy to ease compliance
items.summary: The retail industry needs a "plethora of licences to operate," said Spencer Retail CEO Anuj Singh, while speaking at a panel in IndiaEdge 2025, organised by industry body CII.

items.title: IMF did not question GDP growth figures: Nirmala Sitharaman on lower grade on national accounts
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the IMF praised India’s healthy economic performance and did not question its growth figures. The ‘C’ grade assigned to national accounts data was due to the outdated 2011-12 base year. India will adopt 2022-23 as the new base year from February 27, 2026, ensuring more accurate GDP and GVA calculations.

items.title: DGCA orders IndiGo to submit action plan, fortnightly progress reports as cancellations spike; says monitoring situation
items.summary: IndiGo has been ordered by the DGCA to submit a detailed action plan and fortnightly progress reports as flight cancellations hit 170–200 a day. The Civil Aviation Ministry is closely monitoring the disruptions, while the regulator also asked IndiGo to propose FDTL relaxations and expedite steps to restore normal operations.

items.title: Not just Russia, another trade boost is loading for India
items.summary: India and Canada are reviving stalled trade talks as Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and his Canadian counterpart Maninder Sidhu begin preparations to launch negotiations on the long-pending CEPA pact. The move comes as India seeks new markets amid Trump-era tariffs and a rapidly shifting global trade landscape. CEPA discussions, halted since 2023 due to diplomatic tensions, are regaining momentum with renewed political engagement.

items.title: Mint Explainer | What really went haywire at IndiGo?
items.summary: IndiGo says crew shortages due to new duty-time rules, technical breakdowns at key airports, and heavy winter congestion have precipitated the crisis.&nbsp;

items.title: Nexus Venture closes $700 million fund to double down on AI and tech bets
items.summary: The $700 million fund announced by Nexus Venture Partners will focus on startups in AI, enterprise technology, and fintech in India and the US. Since 2006, it has invested in 130 companies.

items.title: RBI orders weekly loan data reporting to credit information cos from April 1, 2026
items.summary: RBI has mandated that lenders submit borrower data to credit bureaus weekly instead of fortnightly from April 1, 2026. The move aims to improve credit underwriting and loan monitoring. Lenders must update data on fixed dates each month, share full monthly files, and report compliance, with defaulters flagged to RBI.

items.title: Tata, Cyient and Applied Materials win  ₹4,500 crore mandate to modernise India’s lone chip fab
items.summary: SCL Mohali’s long-awaited upgrade moves closer to launch, paving the way for more advanced 28-65 nm industrial chips and reducing import dependence.

items.title: Parliament approves Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025 to levy excise duty on tobacco
items.summary: Parliament has approved a new bill. This legislation will allow for higher excise duty on tobacco products. This change will take effect once the GST compensation cess concludes. The government aims to encourage farmers to switch from tobacco cultivation to other crops. Over one lakh acres are already shifting.

items.title: Strength, resilience and opportunities: Key mantras as India Russia look at strengthening strategic partnership
items.summary: The 23rd Annual Summit between India and Russia held in New Delhi signifies a pivotal moment in the evolution of their economic collaboration. Both nations are eager to uncover fresh opportunities for partnership, particularly in transformative connectivity initiatives. The agenda is rich with discussions aimed at boosting trade and diversifying their economic ties.

items.title: Falling rupee makes imports costlier, fuels inflation: Experts
items.summary: The Indian rupee recently fell below the 90-mark against the US dollar, sparking concerns from opposition parties and raising questions about the impact on ordinary citizens. Experts noted that a weaker rupee benefits exporters and the IT sector by improving competitiveness but makes imports costlier, fueling inflation and squeezing corporate margins.

items.title: Putin’s India visit aims to narrow trade gap, expand exports & seal key deals in shipping, healthcare and connectivity: Sources
items.summary: President Putin's visit to India is set to significantly enhance economic cooperation. Discussions are focused on expanding Indian exports, particularly in pharmaceuticals, agricultural goods, and automobiles. This visit is expected to open new avenues for Indian businesses in the Russian market. Agreements in shipping, healthcare, and connectivity are anticipated. The collaboration will also strengthen people-to-people ties and scientific exchange.

items.title: As Meesho IPO opens, in-house logistics play Valmo emerges as its biggest competitive edge
items.summary: Meesho’s e-commerce empire hinged on unpredictable deliveries. Enter Valmo: the logistics layer that slashed costs, transformed rural fulfilment, and became the unexpected backbone of its public market strategy. What’s ahead?

items.title: ‘Huge opportunities’: Piyush Goyal urges boost in Indian exports to Russia amid $59B deficit
items.summary: India and Russia are working to boost bilateral trade, aiming for USD 70 billion and a more balanced exchange. Significant opportunities exist for Indian exports in consumer goods, food, automobiles, electronics, and textiles. Russia also sees potential for India to increase supplies in agriculture, pharma, and telecom.

items.title: Real estate plot: Developers are moving beyond metros to build on a new property demand trend
items.summary: Plotted developments in smaller cities and towns have become a key component of India’s real estate growth horizon, challenging the historical metro-centric model.

items.title: India seeks bigger slice of China's expanding tea market at buyer-seller meet
items.summary: India is actively promoting its tea exports to China, highlighting the growing popularity of varieties like Darjeeling and Masala tea.  The nation's tea exports to China saw a significant increase from USD 20 million last year to USD 37 million in the first ten months of this year, indicating a rising demand beyond traditional green teas.

items.title: New tax coming for cigarettes and not for essential goods: FM Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the new Health and National Security Cess will primarily focus on demerit goods, including pan masala, ensuring that the revenues generated are channeled into health initiatives and enhancing our national defense.

items.title: Think twice before sending people messages of concern if we fear they’re caught in a disaster
items.summary: In a world saturated with dramatic disaster news, social media gets suffused with earnest messages of concern. Yet, they’re often misplaced, misdirected at those who aren’t in any danger, or worse, a distraction for anyone in the thick of a crisis.

items.title: Startups are filing more patents than ever but this is largely about optics getting the better of innovation
items.summary: India’s startups have been applying for patents at a record pace, but a lack of follow-up efforts to obtain them shows that too much of it is just a marketing tactic to project an innovative image and impress investors. Here’s what India must change to fix awry incentives.

items.title: India targets autos-to-electronics export surge to Russia as Putin set to arrive
items.summary: Puin India Trip: India seeks to expand its exports to Russia, targeting automobiles, electronics, textiles and machinery, Trade Minister Piyush Goyal said ahead of Russian President Vladimir Putin’s visit for the 23rd India-Russia Summit. The meeting comes as both nations reassess their long-standing partnership and explore new trade opportunities amid shifting geopolitical and economic priorities.

items.title: India media & entertainment industry to hit $47 billion by 2029, driven by digital boom
items.summary: Internet advertising, OTT streaming, mobile gaming, and AI-powered creator economy are fuelling growth at almost twice the global rate.

items.title: Can a packed calendar of mega star releases in 2026 deliver the turnaround theatres are waiting for?
items.summary: Trade experts say a powerhouse line-up of Shah Rukh, Salman, Ranbir, Vijay and more in 2026 could revive audience excitement and stabilize box-office revenues, marking a potential inflection point for cinemas after months of inconsistent performance.

items.title: India-Russia tango: Putin means business, and more
items.summary: Putin's New Delhi visit for the India-Russia Summit signals a deepening partnership beyond trade and defence. Discussions focus on expanding economic cooperation, including energy and labour mobility, and reinforcing strategic defence ties with potential new acquisitions. The summit underscores India's commitment to strategic autonomy amidst global pressures.

items.title: Meta-EU antitrust crackdown! Tech giant faces investigation over AI features in WhatsApp: Report
items.summary: Meta-EU antitrust crackdown! Meta Platforms is set to face an antitrust investigation from the European Union over certain artificial intelligence features in WhatsApp. The authorities allegedly claim that the tech giant is harming competition on the continent.

items.title: "Kazakhstan transforming its geographic advantage into a powerful economic asset"
items.summary: Kazakhstan seeks to ensure that digitalization and artificial intelligence become engines of inclusive development - technologies that strengthen our economy, protect our citizens, and enhance the country’s standing in an increasingly digital world, says Azamat Yeskarayev.

items.title: AI can clean up and preserve musical classics but music buffs are rolling their eyes and gnashing their teeth
items.summary: Disney+ has enhanced old footage of The Beatles with AI, but many fans say this ‘restoration’ has crossed a line. As labels and estates race to monetize old catalogues, the line between bringing new life to beloved art and wrecking an artist’s legacy seems perilously thin.

items.title: The ‘gifts’ Ray Dalio and Michael Burry are encouraging followers to consider this holiday season — it's not stocks
items.summary: Investors Ray Dalio and Michael Burry have in separate posts announced their intentions to donate to charities, especially amid the holiday season spirit, and encouraged followers to follow suit.

items.title: Meesho fined  ₹10 lakh for allowing sale of uncertified walkie-talkies
items.summary: This is the largest penalty the CCPA has imposed on any e-commerce platform so far over the sale of uncertified walkie-talkies. Others such as Reliance JioMart, Talk Pro, The MaskMan Toys and Chimiya were previously fined  ₹1 lakh each.

items.title: Affordability versus public goods: Why politics tends to put everyone on the losing side of this divide
items.summary: In the US as in India, political sensitivity to household expenses tilts the scale towards cash transfers. Trump’s ‘tariff funded’ cheques and Bihar’s election-driven handouts are examples. But this generosity starves budgets of badly needed money for public goods. This way, we all lose.

items.title: Russia, India to push toward $100 billion trade turnover by 2030: Russian Finance Minister
items.summary: Russia and India are poised to achieve $100 billion in trade by 2030. According to Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov, the momentum is undeniable, with significant partnerships forming. The recent establishment of a VTB Bank office is a crucial step towards realising this ambitious target.

items.title: Udaan in talks to sell minority stake in its NBFC arm
items.summary: The moves come on the back of a larger restructuring plan as Udaan looks to streamline costs, reduce burn and improve unit economics to free up more cash ahead of a potential IPO next year

items.title: How Ola Electric's 12% unallocated costs helped it show an Ebitda profit in its auto business
items.summary: Ola Electric has set 12% of costs as unallocated expenses in the September quarter, double from the year-ago period. Context: none of its peers had unallocated costs on their books. While a valid accounting practice, experts suggest that such expenses should typically not exceed the 5% level.

items.title: India's Telecom-AI Bundles: Why it's a privacy and competition crisis in the making
items.summary: Telecom alliances with AI firms create opaque data-sharing arrangements that threaten more than privacy. Without regulation mandating transparent commercial ties and shared liability, these bundles risk entrenching monopolies, eroding protections and exposing sensitive user data to AI firms.

items.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang believes you don't need an Ivy League degree to succeed in America — here's why
items.summary: Nvidia chief Jensen Huang believes that success in America is not contingent on an Ivy League degree and shared his example of living the “American dream” as an immigrant. Here's what he said.

items.title: Rupee depreciation set to benefit country’s $283 billion IT sector
items.summary: The recent plunge of the rupee has sparked optimism in India's IT sector, with major companies poised to gain from favorable currency movements. Analysts predict that a weaker rupee will enhance operating margins, providing a cushion amid challenging economic conditions.

items.title: RBI to tolerate weaker rupee as inflows dry up, sources say
items.summary: Reserve Bank of India will now tolerate a weaker rupee amidst multiple external headwinds, including a widening trade gap and stalled dollar inflows. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has shifted from aggressive dollar sales to allowing the rupee to fall, intervening only to curb sharp volatility or speculative build-up, not to defend a specific level.

items.title: Italian police seek governance documents from 13 fashion firms in labour abuse probe
items.summary: ITALY-FASHION/LABOUR-ABUSE:Italian police seek governance documents from 13 fashion firms in labour abuse probe

items.title: Fitch raises India's FY26 GDP forecast to 7.4% from 6.9%, on high consumer spending, GST reforms
items.summary: Fitch Ratings has raised India’s FY26 GDP growth forecast to 7.4% from 6.9%, driven by strong private consumer spending, higher real incomes, and positive effects of GST reforms. This follows government data showing GDP growth hit a six-quarter high of 8.2% in Q2 FY26.

items.title: Budget 2026: Weak forex position, volatile rupee to shape strategy
items.summary: As Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepares the Union Budget for FY27, macroeconomic indicators are guiding fiscal strategy and growth priorities. Foreign exchange reserves, the rupee, and global economic conditions are under close watch.

items.title: OpenAI eyes India market, in ‘advanced’ talks with TCS to build computing infra, agentic AI solutions, says report
items.summary: Sam Altman-led OpenAI is reportedly in advanced talks with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) to build computing infrastructure for artificial intelligence and develop agentic AI solutions for firms in India.

items.title: India, Canada about to turn over a new leaf, trade talks set for a restart
items.summary: India-Canada trade talks: With negotiations set for a restart, officials on both sides face the task of converting the present political goodwill into a structured process. The coming months will test whether the two countries can move beyond past friction and lay the groundwork for a trade agreement that has been nearly a decade in the making.

items.title: IndiGo flights face massive delays after rostering shake-up: How new pilot rest rules triggered a full-blown crisis
items.summary: IndiGo cancelled 200+ flights as new pilot fatigue rules, tech glitches, and an Airbus software update caused nationwide chaos. The DGCA is probing the disruption.

items.title: Donald Trump claims tariffs could someday replace federal income taxes, but experts call idea ‘nonsensical’ — here's why
items.summary: US President Donald Trump claims that revenues from his global tariffs could replace federal income taxes for Americans. But most experts argue this is not feasible, would disrupt economic growth and instead burden lower-income households in the country.

items.title: Parliament winter session: FM Sitharaman to move Health Security se National Security Cess Bill for consideration, passing in LS
items.summary: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to introduce the Health Security National Security Cess Bill, 2025, in the Lok Sabha to fund national security and public health initiatives. The bill proposes levying a cess on specified goods manufacturing processes.

items.title: IndiGo meltdown explained- What is causing hundreds of flight cancellations?
items.summary: IndiGo’s 3 December chaos resulted in over 200 cancellations and major delays nationwide. The DGCA has launched an investigation as the airline cites crew limits and operational challenges.

items.title: NRB shifts gears with strategic leap into industrial bearings via Italian partner Unitec
items.summary: NRB appears to be entering a phase of clarity and confidence, as it steps into industrial bearings through the Unitec joint venture.&nbsp;

items.title: Mint Explainer | New RBI digital banking rules kick in 2026—here’s what it means
items.summary: The central bank’s new framework tightens approvals, raises compliance standards and reshapes how banks deliver digital services to millions of users.

items.title: From Lush to Lululemon: Why global retailers are scrambling for Indian shoppers
items.summary: The influx of global fashion brands into India is driven by rising consumer demand and evolving preferences. As international retailers expand their operations, the Indian retail market is projected to grow significantly, presenting large opportunities.

items.title: Compact cars and SUVs drive three-fourths of India's motor insurance claims, EVs costliest to repair: Report
items.summary: Compact cars and SUVs together account for nearly three-fourths of all motor insurance claims in the country, highlighting their dominance on Indian roads and in insurance payouts, an analysis by PolicyBazaar shows.

items.title: Putin’s India visit comes amid US tariffs and oil sanctions—what’s at stake for New Delhi?
items.summary: The visit comes at a time when India has been facing sustained pressure the US to cut crude purchases from Russia. The high-stakes visit also see India ramping up its defence purchases.

items.title: RBI Ombudsman grievance data shows high retail discontent: Remedial measures, please
items.summary: Grievance data from RBI’s report on its Ombudsman Scheme shows a sharp rise in complaints. Much discontent can be traced to the private sector’s aggressive retail push of recent years. Is the RBI governor’s caution at risk of falling on deaf ears?

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | As the rupee sinks past 90, look at the bright side of a subtle shift in policy
items.summary: A record-low rupee and the utterances of policymakers are consistent with a shift to a lightly managed currency float. While this may cushion India against trade turmoil, it also reduces interference with monetary policy.

items.title: Rupee slide not a worry, says CEA V Anantha Nageswaran as FDI set to top $100 billion
items.summary: Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran downplayed concerns over the rupee's depreciation, stating it's not pressuring inflation and expecting recovery next year. He also highlighted the need for India to "up its game" to attract higher FDI inflows amidst a shifting global economic landscape, while experts noted the rupee's relative stability compared to other emerging market currencies.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Will GST 2.0 consumption boost help Nirmala Sitharaman adhere to fiscal glide path?
items.summary: India's economy is ending the fiscal year strongly. Landmark tax reforms and firm fiscal discipline are key drivers. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is preparing Budget 2026. This budget will focus on strategic spending and economic stability. Global challenges are present. GST collections remain steady after rate cuts. This indicates ongoing economic activity and better compliance.

items.title: ET Graphics: As Rupee breaches 90, a look at who loses and who gains
items.summary: The rupee has hit a historic low against the dollar. This slide raises concerns about import costs and stock market stability. However, the economy shows resilience with strong growth and low inflation. Experts are examining who is affected by this currency movement and who might benefit from it.

items.title: More than rupee level, its non-volatility is key: Bajaj
items.summary: Sanjiv Bajaj, the chairman of Bajaj Finserv, expressed confidence in the rupee's fair value while emphasizing the need to manage its volatility. He downplayed concerns about the rupee potentially reaching 90 against the dollar, highlighting that a low-interest rate climate is conducive to growth in India's manufacturing and infrastructure sectors.

items.title: '8th Economic Census to be held in 2027': Statistics Secretary Saurabh Garg
items.summary: India will conduct its eighth Economic Census in 2027. This census will follow the population census. Data from the Economic Census will establish a statistical business register. This register will map all enterprises across states. It will track their operational status. The Economic Census provides vital information for policy decisions. The population census is scheduled for 2026 and 2027.

items.title: 'Reduce dependence on any single geography for long-term resilience': Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has urged Indian industry to identify weaknesses and innovate for future growth. He stressed reducing reliance on any single country due to the weaponization of trade. Goyal highlighted India's strong economic performance with 8.2% growth and low inflation. He emphasized self-sufficiency in critical products and strengthening domestic supply chains.

items.title: 'Draft Atomic Energy Bill in advanced stage, taking in all ministry inputs': Jitendra Singh
items.summary: India's Atomic Energy Bill 2025 is in its final stages. The government is incorporating suggestions and legal reviews. Discussions with Russia's Rosatom are progressing on nuclear energy cooperation. This includes developing both large and small nuclear power plants. Focus is also on localizing equipment production. Small modular reactors are a key area of discussion.

items.title: CII president Rajiv Memani bats for fresh manufacturing reforms, sovereign wealth fund
items.summary: India must implement new measures to boost manufacturing and supply chain strength. A sovereign wealth fund is proposed to support advanced manufacturing and critical minerals.  The Confederation of Indian Industry suggests using disinvestment funds for long-term transformation.  This plan aims to reduce import dependence and foster local production, creating significant economic value.

items.title: Higher pharma, chemicals exports to Russia bloc on agenda to trim deficit
items.summary: India is negotiating a trade deal with the Eurasian Economic Union to increase exports of pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and engineering goods. The agreement aims to reduce India's trade deficit with Russia. Discussions focus on product categories and potential restrictions. This move comes ahead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit. The EAEU market presents significant opportunities for Indian businesses.

items.title: Sugs Lloyd secures  ₹43.37 crore power infrastructure order from PSPCL
items.summary: The order, precisely valued at  ₹43,37,82,924, is designated for Loss Reduction Works on a turnkey basis under the central government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) in Punjab.

items.title: Manufacturing must be innovation-led, says Goyal; November exports recover after sharp October fall
items.summary: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal said that India’s manufacturing sector must shift towards innovation and resilient supply chains to achieve Viksit Bharat by 2047.

items.title: Strong political push to seal India-EU FTA by 2025-end, says EU Ambassador
items.summary: The EU and India are committed to finalizing their Free Trade Agreement by the end of 2025, with 11 out of 23 chapters already closed. Key areas like market access for cars and services remain under negotiation. This strategic partnership, representing 25% of global GDP and population, aims to boost bilateral trade, currently at $136 billion.

items.title: Targeting public debt is suitable in the current uncertain times, says CEA Nageswaran
items.summary: Creating a rule that cannot be adhered to on an annual basis damages credibility, says chief economic advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran.

items.title: A solar glut is building in India. Can the industry withstand China-style pain?
items.summary: According to estimates from Wood Mackenzie, India’s solar module manufacturing capacity will exceed 125GW by 2025, which is more than three times its domestic demand. The pain of oversupply could force consolidation, separating the men from the boys.

items.title: Mint Explainer | How Air India blundered by missing a routine airworthiness review for an aircraft
items.summary: India's aviation regulator is probing Air India for flying an Airbus A320 without a valid Airworthiness Review Certificate. The airline has acknowledged the error, suspended eight employees, and initiated an internal investigation.

items.title: Mint Explainer | India just approved its first scent trademark—here’s what it means for brands
items.summary: By accepting a rose fragrance on tyres as a trademark, India has entered the era of sensory IP protection. But who stands to gain?

items.title: Mint Explainer: Why are quick commerce platforms selling cosmetics for  ₹1?
items.summary: Higher margins on these products are only part of the reason. &nbsp;

items.title: AI turns vintage tracks into fresh revenue streams for music labels
items.summary: Music labels are leveraging AI to enhance content catalogues, creating videos for audio tracks without visuals. This approach reduces costs by up to 70% and aims to maximize reach on platforms like YouTube, while ensuring the integrity of original art is maintained.

items.title: Power sector proposals brighten India’s energy outlook but lasting gains need a stronger jolt of reforms
items.summary: India’s legislative proposals should help stabilize the power sector and unlock efficiencies. But we’d still need state-level regulatory autonomy and a clear structural separation of supply and network businesses. Let’s aim to attract private investment.

items.title: India may allow e-ambulance manufacturers to import traction motors fitted with rare earth magnets till March
items.summary: India's push for e-ambulances under the PM E-drive scheme highlights the urgent need for localized production of critical components. Experts believe that this initiative will not only enhance service efficiency but also strengthen the domestic supply chain.

items.title: Rupee at 90: How and why it became worst-performing major currency
items.summary: The Indian rupee is now the worst-performing currency among emerging and advanced economies this year as trade tensions, widening deficits, and foreign outflows drag it down to record lows against the US dollar.

items.title: Megacities are both booming and increasingly exposed to the risk of disastrous floods
items.summary: The world’s fast-growing megacities are mostly in Asia and Africa—a tropical belt that’s at high risk of floods as global warming increases atmospheric moisture and makes downpours that much likelier. Yet, there’s no stopping rapid urbanization.

items.title: For a sustainably higher growth path, India mustn’t just mobilize more labour and capital but deploy them more efficient
items.summary: India has recorded GDP growth that makes Viksit Bharat status look reachable, but a closer look reveals that capital deepening has weakened while productivity has been stagnant. This presents a challenge for policymakers who must work out how to push up the economy’s growth trajectory.

items.title: Groceries to gold: How UPI's micro-payments reshaped India's spending habits
items.summary: An average Indian used UPI to make payments worth around  ₹580 per day in November, and this has grown over 40% in the last two years. The growth has come on the back of the rising popularity of small-value payments for groceries and eating out, a detailed Mint analysis reveals.

items.title: India’s services sector growth rebounds in November
items.summary: The HSBC India Services Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), compiled by S&amp;P Global, rises to 59.8 in November from 58.9 in October.

items.title: Mint Explainer | What was behind the now-on, now-off Sanchar Saathi decisions
items.summary: The Centre's order last week to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi cybersecurity app on mobile devices triggered pushback from various quarters. Then, on Wednesday, DoT withdrew the mandatory condition. The core question remains: could the app effectively crack down on digital scams?

items.title: Putin visit: As the world order transforms, India’s ties with Russia must evolve too
items.summary: Putin’s visit to New Delhi offers both India and Russia an opportunity to look beyond the past and find new pathways for cooperation that can yield mutual benefits in a context defined by rapid geopolitical changes. How the talks go will be keenly watched.

items.title: Devina Mehra: Whether there’s an AI bubble or not is a big question—here’s the lowdown on what’s brewing
items.summary: The AI boom may presage a tech revolution. Yet, the stock market surge it has led is narrow and the industry has veered into risky territory with worrisome debt levels and circular deals exposing the financial world to contagion. AI could succeed, but will investors?

items.title: Why acquisitions don’t always work for startups
items.summary: From Byju’s to Zomato, India’s startups have often spent big to grow fast, but not all acquisitions deliver the promised scale or value.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on Wednesday, 3 December, for feast of St. Francis Xavier?
items.summary: Bank Holiday Today, 3 December: Banks in Goa will remain shut on 3 December to observe the feast of St. Francis Xavier, which is the death anniversary of the saint.

items.title: Sanchar Saathi could secure telecom networks but its success should be determined by its appeal as an app
items.summary: Telecom security is a legitimate public objective, but Sanchar Saathi shouldn’t be forced upon smartphones. Coercion stokes suspicion. The government should allay privacy concerns and make its installation voluntary. Let the appeal of its utility work.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Why this year’s silver rally may have more going for it than gold’s upstreak
items.summary: Silver saw a dip on Tuesday, but its blistering rally this year has been led not just by investors seeking refuge from uncertainty, but by booming demand from clean-tech and other industries that use it as an input. How far can prices go?

items.title: How visa delays for Chinese staff threaten India's grand battery plans
items.summary: Chinese workers currently receive six-month visas, after which they must return home and wait for some months before returning.

items.title: Heartburn at lenders as loan rates fall but deposit rates don't
items.summary: Floating-rate loans are repriced immediately, while deposit rates are fixed, squeezing margins, public sector bank chiefs told RBI officials ahead of the 5 December policy outcome.&nbsp;

items.title: At the brink of 90 to a dollar, rupee takes a step back. Where does it go from here?
items.summary: The currency fell for the fifth straight day on steep demand from importers and foreign portfolio investors, shedding 42 paise to close at a record low of 89.87 against the dollar.

items.title: ICICI Bank's 'Baa3' rating reaffirmed by Moody's on strong financials
items.summary: The reaffirmation, according to the Moody's, reflects the bank's robust financial position, which is underpinned by a diversified loan portfolio and above-industry-average profitability.

items.title: Discoms eye solar plus storage solutions, says minister Pralhad Joshi
items.summary: Despite 67.5 GW bid out since April 2023, delays in signing power purchase and sale agreements threaten India’s 2030 renewable targets.

items.title: As Modi-Putin meet nears, Russia says ready to address India's trade deficit concerns
items.summary: He said that addressing India's concerns over the massive trade deficit, cooperation in small modular nuclear reactors and expanding defence and energy ties could be among the focus areas during the summit talks on Friday.

items.title: Nirmala Sitharaman calls for a coordinated global effort to strengthen economic governance
items.summary: When individuals and enterprises pay their fair share, and when evasion is effectively deterred, societies become stronger and more equitable, says finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman

items.title: Broken backs, slim wallets: The farm price deflation that threatens to halt India’s rural demand surge
items.summary: Lower incomes from the Kharif season and a dampened price outlook for the ongoing winter crop season are worrying farmers. That’s also a warning for companies selling both FMCG and durables like fridges and televisions.

items.title: Is India's growth real? Making sense of IMF’s rating and GDP data issues
items.summary: While the GDP data issues are not new, what’s new is the rating system by the IMF—started last year—that has brought to public attention what experts have been saying for close to a decade

items.title: Mint Explainer | Job offers at IITs are getting creative, but can bonuses and clawbacks help firms retain talent?
items.summary: Companies are offering deferred pay, joining bonuses, clawbacks, and stock options to attract IIT graduates—but will it be enough to keep them?

items.title: Law enforcers can use technology to catch criminals but must not violate our constitutional rights
items.summary: Courts in the West have taken a grim view of digital tools that stomp on the basic liberties of people. With privacy having been accorded the status of a fundamental right in India, we should expect the judiciary to defend it squarely.

items.title: OpenAI’s ChatGPT is wooing users while Google’s Gemini tries to outsmart it
items.summary: ChatGPT may have a smarter rival in Google’s Gemini, but OpenAI is betting that what really wins the AI race isn’t smartness but addiction. Usage numbers suggest that Sam Altman’s chatbot will retain its lead despite rave reviews of Google’s offering.

items.title: India is easing its regulatory burden on businesses, but the battle against its inspector raj will be hard fought
items.summary: India has finally begun to clear the regulatory thicket that has long constrained private enterprise, but the effort must pick up pace. We must aim for true economic freedom. Every business needs space to breathe, grow and compete on fair terms.

items.title: Discounts on tickets lure young audiences to multiplexes but dampen spending on food and drinks
items.summary: Urban youth-centric films are popular but multiplex chains like PVR Inox reported a dip in spend-per-head due to high F&amp;B prices. Family-friendly films drive higher concession sales, indicating a need for diverse programming.

items.title: Mint Explainer: Why does the government want to buy back congested highways?
items.summary: The Union government is finalising a new model concession agreement for build-operate-transfer toll highways that will allow it to reclaim stretches of road once traffic touches a predetermined limit. What’s the rationale behind this?

items.title: Liquidity will be most effective for further rate transmission, soothing bond yields
items.summary: With inflation at a series low and GDP growth surpassing expectations, the MPC faces a challenging decision on the repo rate. A potential 25-50 bps cut is likely in the current cycle to support liquidity and economic stability.

items.title: This year’s Nobel lesson for India: Adapt to technological change but manage disruption too
items.summary: Tech breakthroughs yielded two centuries of prosperity. Technology must be harnessed widely and understood closely. Yet, the same forces threaten jobs and social stability. India could gain from ‘creative destruction,’ but must put buffers in place too.

items.title: What awaits the US in 2026: A Goldilocks economy, shallow recession or no-landing scenario?
items.summary: Many indicators point to economic weakness in America, but the downturn may be short-lived. If the US economy stages a recovery in 2026 and the Chinese economy stays resilient, the global outlook will improve. Proceed with cautious optimism.

items.title: India plans global EV summit as it rewrites electric mobility strategy
items.summary: The event will be positioned as a sequel to the 2018 MOVE Summit that was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

items.title: The IMF’s critique of India’s economic statistics is not a cause for alarm but a cue to improve data quality
items.summary: The Fund awarded India a ‘C’ grade in its assessment of our macro data quality. Its criticism of our estimates is best taken as a cue to further improve the country’s statistical framework. Thankfully, remedial work has already begun.

items.title: Jerome Powell's Stanford speech misses comments on US economy, monetary policy as Trump prepares to name new Fed chief
items.summary: Jerome Powell delivers opening remarks at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, praising former US Secretary of State George Shultz.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Do November’s GST collections expose the limits of India’s mid-year stimulus?
items.summary: The GST reset was expected to stimulate a consumption boom, but the latest tax mop-up data suggests we may need to temper expectations. That said, it’s still too early to draw conclusions.

items.title: Cyber Monday spending could surge to massive $14.2 billion as big deals outweigh economic fears in US
items.summary: Cyber Monday deals attracted US shoppers on December 1 even as economic uncertainties persisted. This was 6.3% increase from 2024, with experts predicting record sales.

items.title: Exports buoy agrichem firms, revenue growth seen consolidating to 6-7% in FY26: Crisil
items.summary: The industry’s return to its long-term growth range of 8-10% next fiscal year will depend on whether exports sustain the current momentum and domestic demand strengthens from this year’s weak base, Crisil said

items.title: Banks can't rely on service providers' assurance: RBI deputy guv on technology outsourcing
items.summary: RBI deputy governor Swaminathan J. urges lenders to gain a deep understanding of the technology, control environment, and the concentration risk that arises when they depend on the same provider.

items.title: Buying tobacco or pan masala? New Excise, Health Security se National Security Bills to bring these changes
items.summary: During the Winter session of Parliament, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced Bills to impose a cess on tobacco and tobacco products.

items.title: India's growth numbers surprise, but do not worry economists
items.summary: Among the reasons why the GDP growth appears higher than forecasts is the unavailability of high-frequency indicators for services growth and private consumption, sectors that have exhibited strong growth in the July-September quarter, analaysts said

items.title: India’s October industrial growth at 14-month low of 0.4%
items.summary: Provisional MoSPI data for October point to an uneven industrial recovery, with manufacturing, mining and electricity showing mixed momentum across key use-based segments.

items.title: Govt seeks parliament nod for net extra spending of  ₹41,455 crore this year
items.summary: The finance ministry has sought lawmakers' approval for an extra  ₹41,455 crore spending this fiscal year for subsidies and administrative costs, including fertilizer and urea imports. Despite this, the fiscal deficit target remains intact due to potential savings and high GDP growth.

items.title: India is rediscovering its waterways. Can a Kochi experiment go national?
items.summary: Kochi’s successful water metro, featuring modern electric boats, is now the blueprint for the nation, inspiring feasibility studies across many congested cities, including in Mumbai and Goa. An inside story.

items.title: Digital personal data protection: The rules are a flickery lighthouse and following them won’t be easy
items.summary: India has finally set sail on privacy enforcement online, but this voyage is unlikely to be smooth. The law promises meaningful control of personal data to every individual. Yet, the rules are full of riddles for businesses trying to comply. Here is a look at some.

items.title: Your attention is the new currency for India's streaming apps.
items.summary: Metrics such as total time spent by users on a platform, time spent per session, content completion rates, and user interactions, including likes, comments, and shares, get priority plateauing paid subscriber growth.

items.title: India's gross GST collections rose to  ₹1.7 trillion in November over lower tax rates
items.summary: The November GST revenue growth of 0.7%—the year's slowest—before adjusting for tax refunds, also bears the brunt of the 25% additional tariff the US imposed on India from 27 August.

items.title: Animation meets mythology: Can Mahavatar Narsimha’s ₹300 cr triumph spark change in Indian films?
items.summary: Mahavatar Narsimha, an animated mythological film, grossed  ₹300 crore without marketing, marking a shift in India's animation landscape.

items.title: Quantitative tightening has its limits: Don’t expect the US Fed to keep at it
items.summary: Some observers want the US Federal Reserve to shrink its balance sheet further in the hope of making capital cheaper and ending its distortive impact, but the picture isn’t so simple. Further asset reduction is unlikely to help reduce interest rates and may even create new financial risks.

items.title: Dani Rodrik: How should the world respond to China’s growing export dominance?
items.summary: China’s export juggernaut has triggered calls for tariffs and reshoring, but these are suboptimal responses. Policymakers have better ways to safeguard jobs and advanced manufacturing while pursuing national security objectives. Here’s what would serve their aims better.

items.title: India’s manufacturing activity eases to a nine-month low in November as export orders slow
items.summary: New export orders PMI fell to a 13-month low and business confidence, as indicated by expectations for future output, also showed a big fall in November

items.title: Mint Explainer | GDP at 8.2%, fiscal deficit rising: What it means for the Indian economy
items.summary: India’s latest data shows a sharp growth surprise alongside mounting fiscal pressures, offering a mixed picture of the economy’s underlying momentum.

items.title: Mega PSU bank merger plan: Can India do it without amplifying risks?
items.summary: India plans new PSB mergers to create global-sized banks to fund major projects. Success depends on balancing scale against the heightened systemic risk of concentrated power.

items.title: The geopolitics of rare-earth magnets: India needs a wide-angle approach to satisfy growing demand
items.summary: India can now produce some critical rare-earth metals, but reliance on China for advanced magnets exposes a structural vulnerability. With supply chains getting weaponized, the Centre has unveiled a new scheme. Our strategy, however, may need to both broaden and sharpen.

items.title: Banking sakhis have revolutionized access to financial services in rural India: Let’s strengthen this network
items.summary: The banking correspondent network of sakhis has shown the wonders of doorstep banking in rural India. The next stage of success will depend on strengthening their network through various means, including better training, infrastructure and institutional support.

items.title: Govt to introduce Central Excise Amendment Bill, 2025: What it means for tobacco and pan masala prices?
items.summary: As Parliament introduces new bills to replace the GST compensation cess on tobacco and pan masala, significant tax changes loom. Will these measures maintain current prices, or will they reshape the market landscape? Discover the implications of these legislative moves on consumers and revenue.

items.title: The Indian economy’s 8.2% second-quarter growth: Can it expand at such a brisk pace for years to come?
items.summary: Last quarter’s data has cheered India, but the challenge is to keep the economy growing at 8% plus for years to come. This year’s consumption stimulus may be working, but the investment rate must rise. For the private sector to do its bit, revive public-private infrastructure partnerships.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | India’s SIM binding rule will overburden users of messaging apps: Is there no other way?
items.summary: India’s SIM-binding rule for messaging apps may make chats traceable, but it will also make web-based access to WhatsApp et al—which is especially useful abroad—too troublesome. Isn’t there a better way to achieve the government’s objectives?

items.title: Elon Musk reveals the only way to reduce ‘insanely high’ US debt on Nikhil Kamath's WTF Podcast
items.summary: During the nearly two-hour-long WTF Podcast, Nikhil Kamath asked Elon Musk about the rising US debt and possible ways to address it. The Zerodha co-founder's WTF podcast was released on Sunday, featuring Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

items.title: Govt mulling relaxations as made-in-India battery push runs into delays
items.summary: The Union heavy industries ministry is weighing extensions and easier localization norms for the beneficiaries of the  ₹18,100-crore PLI-ACC scheme that was announced in 2021.

items.title: Bigger cheques return to Indian startups as investor confidence rises
items.summary: Deal value is on the mend as well, and that's despite lower volumes. While 2024 saw early-stage startups raise $1.5 billion across 513 deals, this year so far has seen 432 deals with companies raising a total of $1.6 billion.&nbsp;

items.title: RBI may hold rates steady in December, economists split on possible cut
items.summary: Hopes of an interest rate cut this week are receding—Given record low inflation and high GDP growth, the majority of economists in a Mint poll believe that the MPC may leave the repo rate untouched this week. The rest have reasons to think there will still be an interest rate cut.

items.title: CII suggests green finance institution, green tech expo fund for FY27 Budget
items.summary: The industry body emphasized the urgent need for an estimated $1 trillion in green investments over the next 10-15 years, highlighting that current finance flows cover only about 25% of this requirement.

items.title: Swiss voters reject proposed tax on super rich
items.summary: Switzerland on Sunday overwhelmingly rejected a proposed 50% tax on inherited fortunes of 50 million Swiss francs or more, with 78% of votes against the plan, an outcome that even exceeded the two‑thirds opposition indicated in polls.

items.title: India’s lab-grown diamond market makes the cut as investor interest surges in 2025
items.summary: Nine pure-play lab grown diamond startups collectively raised a record $26.4 million in 2025, compared with $4.7 million across eight startups last year, according to data from market intelligence provider Tracxn

items.title: Swadeshi shopping to winter tourism, Modi urges support for India-made goods
items.summary: During his monthly radio address, Modi encouraged buying Indian-made products for the upcoming festive season, noting significant food grain production increases and the economic growth driven by local consumption. He also urged exploration of winter tourism in the Himalayas.

items.title: Death by overuse: Let’s refrain from using the term ‘reform’ for every policy change that’s announced
items.summary: The reflexive use of the word ‘reform’ to describe every policy change risks stripping the word of meaning. Moves like GST rationalization and labour law revisions need to be put to a test: Do they improve things for all stakeholders?

items.title: The role of apparel in climate action: How the fast fashion industry could become a catalyst for green hydrogen
items.summary: China is racing ahead not just on clean green hydrogen, but also fast fashion with mega-successes like Shein. Should demand for petrochem synthetics that go into shoes and clothes be met by using green rather than dirty hydrogen, it would cut carbon emissions.

items.title: Mint Explainer: Soon, no WhatsApp without a SIM card. What DoT’s new rules mean.
items.summary: Currently, first-time users of apps such as WhatsApp can only use their services after phone number verification. However, after this verification is complete, users can continue to use these apps even after removing their SIM card.

items.title: Climate change impact? Report flags challenges to Indian exports, 4.5% of GDP at risk due to extreme climate events
items.summary: India's export industries, particularly aluminium, iron, and steel, face increasing climate risks affecting profits and operations. By 2030, up to 4.5% of India's GDP could decline due to extreme weather.

items.title: Bank holidays next week: When are banks closed from 1-7 December? Check here
items.summary: Bank holidays next week: From December 1 to December 7, banks in certain Indian states will observe two holidays, specifically on December 1 for State Inauguration Day and December 3 for the Feast of St. Francis Xavier, with all banks closed on Sundays.

items.title: India might be the 'perfect' emerging market, strategist says
items.summary: EMQQ Global founder and chief investment officer Kevin Carter sits down with Julie Hyman to discuss investing in emerging markets, like India (^NSEI), China (000001.SS), and Latin America, compared to US stocks (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein believes India could emerge as a winner if the US economy enters a recession, given country’s unique economic resilience and strong domestic drivers. “The largest and the fifth-largest economies have in the past often been fairly independent of each other without strong linkages,” analyst at Bernstein said. Brokerage turned positive on India’s equity markets earlier this year after a cautious outlook in 2024, maintains that India’s macroeconomic recovery is already und

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.

items.title: Indian mutual funds need to focus on investor expectations, not just returns
items.summary: Investing.com -- Indian mutual funds should focus more on managing investor expectations rather than just chasing returns. Fund houses often overlook how retail investors react to market ups and downs, which affects long-term performance.

items.title: Avoid Indian equities, stay long on bonds
items.summary: Investing.com -- Investors should steer clear of Indian equities as corporate profits are set to shrink, and economic growth is expected to decelerate.

items.title: Bernstein says 'buy selectively' on Indian equities for 2025
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein says “buy selectively” on Indian equities for 2025, given macroeconomic challenges and earnings misses. It projects the Nifty 50 to reach 26,500 by the end of the year, a 12% return.
